description: Russian TG-channels spread false information about outdoor advertising in New York celebrating the 10-year anniversary of Crimea's return to Russia. However, the Center for Countering Disinformation debunked this claim, revealing that the original video actually advertised different content. This is another attempt by Russian propagandists to legitimize the occupation of Crimea and create the illusion of Western support.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original: #ЦПД_debunks: Russian TG-channels distribute videos of outdoor advertising "Crimea is Russia! 10 years united" from New York. According to the propagandists, "New York is celebrating the 10-year anniversary of Crimea's return to Russia." ✅ After verifying the information, the Center reports that this "advertisement" is yet another falsification by Russian propagandists, as the original video broadcasts advertising of a different content. ▫️Spreading such fakes, Russian propagandists are trying to legitimize the occupation of the Ukrainian peninsula and create the illusion of its support by Western society. TGFBINSTYTTWTTWA

event: Arrest of Ukrainian Citizen for Metro Attacks
description: Milan police arrested a 16-year-old Ukrainian citizen accused of four metro attacks on February 29. The suspect targeted victims based on their geographical origin, displaying a swastika tattoo before attacking. Authorities seized various materials, including a machete with a 'White Power' inscription, a knife, hammers, a 'Duce' banner, and a copy of 'Mein Kampf'.
original:
Corriere della Sera: In Milan, police arrested a 16-year-old Ukrainian citizen, accused of four attacks in the city metro on the night of February 29. Police investigators established that the 16-year-old chose his victims based on their “geographical origin” (two were from from Sri Lanka). He would approach them, showing a swastika tattooed on his chest, and then attack.

Also during the operation, officers seized various materials: a machete with the inscription “White Power” engraved on it, a knife, several hammers, a banner with the inscription “Duce” and a copy of “Mein Kampf” by Adolf Hitler. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVIOV!

description: Khabarovsk customs officers seized diary entries of J. Goebbels, a prominent Nazi ideologist, from a Russian woman traveling to China. The book, which justifies discrimination and violence against Jews, is included in the Federal List of Extremist Materials. An administrative case has been initiated, and the materials have been submitted to the court.
original:
Diary entries of the propagandist of the Third Reich J. Goebbels were seized from a Russian woman by Khabarovsk customs officers. Prohibited literature was found when scanning the luggage of a woman traveling to China. She told the inspectors that the book was intended for personal reading, and that she had no idea that it was banned in Russia, the Federal Customs Service of Russia reported.

The examination confirmed that this is the work of the main ideologist of Nazism, justifying discrimination and violence against Jews. The publication is included in the Federal List of Extremist Materials.

An administrative case has been initiated, the materials have been submitted to the court. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Marine Struna, a Hero of Russia, attributed the high support for the president in new Russian regions to the fact that people were waiting for help and received it from the Russian Federation. He emphasized that fighters in the Northern Military District zone have strong support from their families and other Russians, who send care packages to the front lines.
original:
The legendary marine, Hero of Russia, with the call sign Struna, explained the high support for the president in the new regions of Russia by the fact that people were waiting for help and received it from the Russian Federation.
In a conversation with RT, he noted that the fighters in the Northern Military District zone have a powerful rear - they are supported by their wives, children and other Russians: “Any little thing that comes to the front from any caring person is very much appreciated there.”

description: A fire in a residential building in the village of Is, Nizhnyaya Tura, Sverdlovsk region, resulted in the deaths of a woman and her three children. Investigators from the regional Investigative Committee of Russia are inspecting the scene to establish the circumstances of the incident.
location: Is, Nizhnyaya Tura, Sverdlovsk Oblast, Russia
original:
In the Sverdlovsk region, investigators from the regional Investigative Committee of Russia are inspecting the scene of a fire in a residential building, which killed three children and their mother. On March 19, while extinguishing a fire in a residential building on Lenin Street in the village of Is, Nizhnyaya Tura, the bodies of a dead woman and her three children were discovered - girls born in 2007, as well as boys born in 2012 and 2013.

To establish all the circumstances of what happened in this case, the investigative authorities of the Investigative Committee of Russia in the Sverdlovsk Region opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Part 3 of Article 109 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (causing death by negligence of two or more persons).

Together with representatives of the department of forensic support of the investigation (based in Yekaterinburg) of the Main Directorate of Forensic Science (Forensic Center) of the Investigative Committee, the recording and seizure of material evidence is carried out, witnesses are interrogated, a set of examinations is appointed. During the investigation, the causes and conditions that contributed to the tragedy are also revealed. .Subscribe to Sledkom

description: A resident of Izyum District was detained for passing information about Ukrainian defenders' locations to Russian representatives via Telegram. The individual, who had previously collaborated with occupiers, was found hiding in Krasnograd and remanded in custody.
original:
🔷Detained an enemy accomplice who passed on information about the location of Ukrainian defenders in the Izyum District (Part 1 of Article 111-2, Part 2 of Article 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, a resident of The recruiter of the Izyum district "leaked" information about the location of the personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and military equipment to representatives of the Russian Federation via Telegram. In particular, in September 2023, he sent a screenshot of a map with a mark where Ukrainian defenders were stationed.

The man began actively helping the invaders during the occupation of Izyum Oblast in 2022. Then he became so "friendly" with the occupiers that they tasked him with checking citizens' documents at checkpoints, giving him weapons. At the same time, the enemy henchman was dressed in a Russian military uniform with the Russian tricolor on his arm.

It has been established that the man is not officially employed and has previously had problems with the law.

After the deoccupation, the enemy's accomplice hid from the investigation for a long time. However, in March of this year, law enforcement officers located him and detained him in the city of Krasnograd, when the man tried to escape to uncontrolled territories.

At the request of the prosecution, the suspect was remanded in custody.

The detection and documentation of illegal activities was carried out together with the investigators of the VP No. 1 of the Izyum RUP of the State Police in the Kharkiv region under the operational support of the SBU Department in the Kharkiv region. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

event: Plan for Restoration of Tourism Infrastructure
description: The Russian Ministry of Economic Development has prepared a plan to restore tourism infrastructure in new regions, requiring approximately 90 billion rubles for implementation from 2024-2025. The plan includes allocating 521 million rubles from the federal budget for tourism infrastructure development, with 213 million rubles for modular hotel construction and 307.9 million rubles for a single subsidy.
original: The Ministry of Economic Development of Russia has prepared a plan for the restoration of tourism infrastructure in new regions. The plan is designed for 2024-2025, its implementation will require about 90 billion rubles." Today we are actively discussing this with the construction block. We hope that with the support of Marat Shakirzyanovich [Khusnullin] sources will be here in the near future we’ll find it,” said Vitaly Altabaev, director of the regional development department of the Ministry of Economic Development. He also noted that as part of the national tourism project in 2024, 521 million rubles from the federal budget will be allocated for the development of tourism infrastructure in these regions. Of these, 213 million rubles will be spent on the construction of modular hotels, and 307.9 million rubles will be spent on providing a single subsidy.

description: The EU is secretly planning for Ukraine's membership, along with Moldova and some Western Balkan countries. However, the EU is not publicly discussing this due to concerns about imports and farmers' protests. Ukraine's integration is expected to bring €186 billion in revenue within 7 years, but it also raises concerns about Ukraine's significant influence in the European Parliament and the Council of the EU.
original:
The EU is secretly preparing for Ukraine to join the bloc, - Politico. The publication writes that in addition to Ukraine, it is also planned to join Moldova and some countries of the Western Balkans, but the EU does not publicly talk about admission due to imports and farmers’ protests.

In addition, as Politico reports, there are concerns that Ukraine, with a population of 44 million people, will become the largest territory in the bloc and “will have significant influence in the European Parliament and the Council of the EU,” but the integration of Ukraine would bring €186 billion in revenue for the country within 7 years.

event: First Criminal Case on LGBT Extremism
description: Russia's first criminal case on LGBT extremism was opened against the Pose queer club in Orenburg. The club was accused of being an extremist organization under Article 282.2 of the Criminal Code. Previous raids on the club had seized equipment and items, and the Ministry of Internal Affairs claimed it was a gathering place for a banned movement.
original:
🏳️‍🌈😡The first criminal case on extremism due to LGBT was opened in Russia. The queer club Pose from Orenburg was persecuted under the article on “activities of an extremist organization” (Article 282.2 of the Criminal Code), serial informer Ekaterina Mizulina reported on her channel. Previously, this institution was repeatedly raided to denounce local Z-patriots from the “Russian Community”. The last time, on March 12, security forces seized equipment and “packages with women’s clothing and wigs.” The Ministry of Internal Affairs reported that it stopped the work of a nightclub where “representatives of a [non-existent] movement banned in the Russian Federation gathered.”

This is the first such case since the Supreme Court declared the “international LGBT movement” extremist. It is still unknown whether there are any defendants in the case. Formally, LGBT people were included in the Russian register of extremist organizations only on March 1. What exactly will now be recognized as extremism is unclear.

description: Alexey Isakov, a 40-year-old war veteran, shot and killed his business partner in a St. Petersburg restaurant over a dispute involving 7 million rubles. Isakov, who had a prior criminal record, was detained by security forces shortly after the incident.
original:
A participant in the war in Ukraine shot a man in a St. Petersburg restaurant, and then returned to the table and continued to eat. Returning from the war in Ukraine, 40-year-old Alexey Isakov, who had previously served time in a colony, killed his business partner in the Chabrets restaurant on Moskovsky Avenue in St. Petersburg. Fontanka writes about this.

The murder was caught on CCTV. The footage shows how one of the men sitting at the table takes out a pistol and shoots his interlocutor several times. After this, the shooter returns to the table and continues to eat. Soon Isakov was detained by security forces; he did not try to escape, Fontanka reports.

According to the publication, a conflict arose between the men over seven million rubles, which Isakov is convinced was owed to him by the murdered business partner.

Fontanka suggests that Isakov went to war after being freed from the colony. According to public records, in May 2021 he was sentenced to three and a half years in prison in a theft case. Isakov was also previously convicted of driving while intoxicated.

In addition, in 2018, Isakov was detained on suspicion of car theft, Fontanka writes. Then they found his FSIN employee ID on him. Isakov said that he previously worked in this field, was fired, and did not hand over his certificate because it was lost, but was later found. Apparently, he was not brought to justice. Video: “Fontanka” (TW: brutal footage) Subscribe to Dozhd’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

description: A Russian serviceman, misled by Defense Minister Shoigu's false report of the village of Krynki being cleared, experienced cognitive dissonance upon encountering Ukrainian defense. In shock, he shot himself in the head with a machine gun and was subsequently finished off by a Ukrainian drone operator, along with his comrade.
original: Russian Defense Minister S. Shoigu drove a Russian serviceman to suicide in the village of Krynki, Kherson region. As you know, Shoigu reported to Putin about the complete clearing of the village of Krynki by Russian troops. Obviously, this Russian soldier experienced cognitive dissonance upon encountering Ukrainian defense in Krynki. As a result of the shock he experienced, the Russian shot himself in the head with a machine gun, and was mercifully finished off by the operator of the Ukrainian drone along with his comrade. And all because of Shoigu’s false report. But not a single Russian military correspondent will write about this, they will be afraid.

event: France and Poland Restrict Ukrainian Agricultural Imports
description: France and Poland have joined forces to restrict imports of Ukrainian agricultural products, potentially derailing negotiations on extending Kyiv's free trade with the EU for another year. This move could cost Ukraine 1.2 billion euros in trade income, a significant blow to the country's economy.
original:
France has joined Poland in an attempt to restrict imports of Ukrainian agricultural products, threatening to derail negotiations on extending Kyiv's free trade with the EU for another year - Politico

The publication, citing diplomats, reports that this will cost Ukraine 1.2 billion euros in trade income.

"This is a huge cut for a country that really needs all the help it can get. It turns out that the member states that are most supportive of Ukraine are also the ones that are hurting it the most," the unnamed diplomat said.

description: Russian attack aircraft have dropped 3,500 bombs on Ukrainian Armed Forces positions since the beginning of 2024, a 16-fold increase from 2023. This significant escalation is attributed to Russia's advantage in available weapons and the depletion of Ukraine's air defense missile stocks, resulting in substantial losses of military equipment and personnel.
original:
Russian aircraft have dropped 3,500 bombs on the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces since the beginning of 2024. Russian attack aircraft have dropped 3,500 bombs on the positions of the Kyiv regime formations since the beginning of 2024. According to the Militarist telegram channel, this figure was announced by one of the leaders of the Ukrainian military department, Lieutenant General Ivan Gavrilyuk.

According to him, this is sixteen times more than in 2023. A senior official noted that our side is using its advantage in available weapons without actually reducing the intensity of the fire. At the same time, the production capabilities of Ukraine and NATO countries are significantly lower.

There is also a depletion of air defense missile stocks, which allows the Aerospace Forces to operate more intensively. This leads to significant losses of military equipment and manpower and affects the configuration of the line of combat contact.

He was taken there by ambulance. Doctors diagnosed him with acute vascular insufficiency.

Immediately after hospitalization, he was connected to a ventilator. Resuscitation efforts did not produce results - he died at 18.01.

The preliminary cause of death is pulmonary embolism. TelegramBaza Journalist and commentator Vasily Utkin has died. He was 52 years old.

description: Marina Rakova, former Deputy Minister of Education, was sentenced to 5 years in prison and fined 900,000 rubles for her involvement in a fraud case related to the 'Teacher of the Year' project. The case involved seven individuals from the Ministry of Education, RANEPA, and Shaninka, who allegedly stole 21 million rubles in budget money.
original: Former Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to 5 years in prison in a fraud case. This decision was made by the Nikulinsky Court of Moscow, the correspondent of “Caution, News” reports. She was also fined 900 thousand rubles. The case involves seven people from the Ministry of Education, RANEPA and Shaninka. They were detained in October 2021, but all were released from the pre-trial detention center by November 2022. The investigation believes that the defendants in the case participated in the theft of budget money as part of the implementation of the federal project “Teacher of the Year” of the national project “Education”. The total amount of damage amounted to 21 million rubles. Vladimir Mau, who at that time held the position of rector of RANEPA, was also involved in the case, but the charges against him were dropped and he left Russia.

description: A crew of the Buk-M1 air defense missile system shot down a Ukrainian attack helicopter in the Artemovsk direction. The helicopter was detected at a height of 500-600m and was accompanied for 10km before being destroyed at a distance of 7-8km from the combat contact line.
original: A crew of the Buk-M1 air defense missile system shot down a Ukrainian helicopter. A Ukrainian attack helicopter was destroyed in the Artemovsk direction by a crew of the Buk-M1 anti-aircraft missile system of the South group of troops. The commander of an anti-aircraft battery battalion with the call sign Quiet spoke about this: “...They gave us instructions from the command post to detect an enemy vehicle. The height of the target was 500–600 m. We calmly took it and accompanied it for about 10 km, we already knew that it was coming, coming towards us, and as soon as it entered the affected area, we destroyed it...” According to Tikhy, the Ukrainian Armed Forces helicopter has long been was the target of the Russian army, he was ambushed and eliminated at a distance of 7–8 km from the line of combat contact. The Buk anti-aircraft missile system is capable of shooting down a target flying at speeds of up to 800 m/s. The damage radius is up to 20 km.

Representatives of the chief region also sawed down trees near the house on Vostochnaya Street. The crowns had grown and hung over the roof, which meant they posed a danger to the building and the townspeople.

Penza specialists are providing assistance to local utility workers on behalf of Governor Oleg Melnichenko. With their assistance, public transport stops and public gardens are being developed.

original:

According to him, the investigation established that the suspect organized the illegal accrual of bonuses from 2019 to 2022, after which she received part of these bonuses and disposed of the stolen funds at her own discretion.

description: A former policeman in Kalmykia was sentenced to seven years in prison for causing an accident while driving intoxicated, resulting in one death and serious harm to two others.
original:
Forwarded from: News of Kalmykia
In Kalmykia, an ex-policeman received seven years in prison after an accident with the death of a person. The Elista City Court on Tuesday sentenced a former policeman to seven years in a penal colony for committing an accident, which resulted in the death of a person and serious harm to two others. The culprit of the accident was driving while intoxicated, the press service of the regional prosecutor's office reported.

Earlier, with reference to the press service of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the region, it was reported that a criminal case was opened by the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs in Kalmykia following an accident involving an employee of the department, in which one person died and three were hospitalized. The case was transferred for investigation to the Investigative Committee of Russia for the republic, the suspect was detained and placed under house arrest. Then the Supreme Court of Kalmykia arrested the suspect.

“The former police officer was found guilty by the Elista City Court under paragraph “a” of Part 4 of Art. 264 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (violation by a person driving a car while intoxicated of the traffic rules of the Russian Federation, which through negligence resulted in the death of a person or causing serious harm to human health). The court, taking into account the position of the state prosecutor, sentenced the defendant to seven years in prison to be served in a penal colony. The man was also deprived of the right to engage in driving vehicles for a period of two and a half years,” the report says.

The court found that on the evening of September 17, 2023, an inspector from one of the departments of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the Republic of Kalmykia was driving a Lada Priora car while intoxicated along the Elista - Arzgir - Mineralnye Vody highway. A Lada Priora driven by a policeman drove into the adjacent lane and collided with a Lada Granta car moving in the opposite direction. One passenger in the oncoming car died at the scene, two others received serious injuries. @kalmnovostiTACC In Kalmykia, an ex-policeman received seven years in prison after an accident with the death of a person. The arrested person was driving while intoxicated

description: A passenger left his bank card in an ATM at Lianozovo station of the Moscow metro. An attacker withdrew 22,000 rubles from the victim's card, taking advantage of the incomplete service session. The defendant has been identified and is being prosecuted for theft from a bank account, causing significant damage to a citizen.
location: Lianozovo Station, Moscow Metro, Moscow, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: MOSCOW PROSECUTOR'S OFFICE
In the northern lobby of the Lianozovo station of the Moscow metro, a passenger, having deposited funds into his account, left his bank card in the ATM. The attacker, having approached the ATM, wanted to withdraw funds from his card, however, seeing on the ATM screen that the previous user had not completed service session and left the card, withdrew 22 thousand rubles from the victim’s card. The defendant has been identified, his prosecution for theft from a bank account causing significant damage to a citizen (clause “d”, part 3 of article 158 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) is under control in Prosecutor's Office of the Moscow Metro.

description: A 45-year-old local resident with a criminal history was arrested for committing robberies at bus stops in Yalta, Crimea. He targeted victims at night, hitting them on the head and stealing their personal belongings, including smartphones and money.
original:
The Crimean beat people at bus stops and took away their personal belongings. He was taken into custody. As reported by the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Crimea, the Yalta police received several reports of robberies committed near the bus stop. An unknown person approached the 33-year-old man at night, hit him in the head several times, grabbed his smartphone and disappeared. The thief made a similar attack on another passerby, robbing him of his phone and money. “The police detained the suspect, a 45-year-old local resident who already had criminal experience, in hot pursuit. The attacker dismantled one of the mobile phones and threw it away, however, money and a communication device belonging to another applicant were seized and returned to the owner,” the report says. It also turned out that earlier the robber, while drinking alcohol with a new acquaintance, stole his phone worth about 70 thousand rubles.

Criminal cases have been initiated under Part 2 of Article 161 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Robbery” and under Part 2 of Article 158 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Theft”. The man could face a maximum sentence of up to 7 years in prison.@crimea24new

event: Warning Against French Military Involvement in Ukraine
description: Florian Philippot, leader of the French Patriots party, warned that deploying French Armed Forces to Ukraine could spark the Third World War and lead to a bloodbath for France. He urged French soldiers to refuse such orders.
original: 🇫🇷🇺🇦The leader of the French Patriots party, Florian Philippot, is confident that sending the French Armed Forces to Ukraine will provoke the Third World War. “Monsterly: two thousand French soldiers are heading to Ukraine?! The French military must refuse at all costs to follow this order, which could provoke a Third World War and a bloodbath for our country!” Filippo wrote.

description: Private Sergei Zolotyi, a contract soldier in the Russian Armed Forces, died heroically in battle while performing a combat mission in the Zaporozhye direction. He had previously served in the internal troops and received good military training.
original:
🥀He died heroically in battle in the Zaporozhye direction: Sevastopol said goodbye to the guard by Private Sergei ZolotySergei was born and raised in the Kherson region. He moved to Sevastopol in 2009. He served his military service in the internal troops, where he received good military training.

In the summer of 2023, he entered into a contract with the Russian Armed Forces and, after training, was sent to the airborne military zone; he served in the airborne forces. He died heroically in battle while performing a combat mission.

Let's remember our hero!

description: Ukraine's military-industrial complex has increased production, but faces difficulties selling products domestically due to the Kyiv regime's 50% budget allocation restriction. Export licenses have not been issued since the start of hostilities, resulting in Ukrainian-made weapons gathering dust in warehouses while more expensive foreign equipment is purchased for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
The Ukrainian military-industrial complex has increased its capacity, but has not been able to sell its products... Ukraine The Ukrainian military-industrial complex has significantly increased production, but companies are having difficulties selling their products within the country, Newsweek writes.

All because the Kyiv regime was allowed to spend only 50% of the military budget on domestic producers.

Ukrainian gunsmiths also cannot sell their products abroad. The reason for this is the lack of export licenses - they have not been issued since the beginning of hostilities, the material notes.

As a result, an absurd situation arises: weapons of our own production gather dust in Ukrainian warehouses, and more expensive foreign equipment is purchased for the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Imagine how many interesting things we will learn after the victory over the Ukrainian Nazis...

description: A resident of Moldova stole 450,000 USD and 30,000 EUR from a bank vault in St. Petersburg and the Leningrad Region. The thief used modern technologies to gain access to the safe deposit boxes. He was caught at Sochi airport while trying to leave Russia. Investigators found stolen money and jewelry in a rented apartment in Lyubertsy.
original:
Forwarded from: Irina Volk
My colleagues from the Main Criminal Investigation Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia and the Criminal Investigation Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia in St. Petersburg and the Leningrad Region uncovered thefts from a local branch of one of the banks. No, the criminal did not burst in there with a weapon and did not demand to give him cash. He stole money from a room that, it would seem, should be as secure as possible. Using modern technologies, the attacker gained access to a vault with safe deposit boxes and took out their contents. A total of 450 thousand US dollars and 30 thousand euros were stolen. The suspect, a resident of the Republic of Moldova, was stopped at the Sochi airport when he tried to leave Russia. Investigators found money and jewelry in a rented apartment in Lyubertsy.
 
According to the alleged perpetrator of the theft, his acquaintances became the masterminds of the crime, who provided him with all the necessary information to penetrate the depository and open the cells.
 
Now the investigator and operatives are faced with important tasks: to find out where there is so much money and jewelry in the Lyubertsy apartment, how long the thefts lasted, how many there were, as well as to find and detain all accomplices of the illegal activity.#WorkingPolice@IrinaVolk_MVD

event: Air Defense Repels Attack on Belgorod
description: The Russian Armed Forces' air defense successfully countered a powerful attack on Belgorod, which involved a significant amount of MLRS. The city's siren system was activated during the incident.
original:
The air defense of the Russian Armed Forces repels another powerful attack on Belgorod.

With half a package of MLRS. A siren sounds over the city

event: Increased Attacks on Energodar and Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant
description: Ukrainian troops have escalated their attacks on Energodar and the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant, particularly using drones. The city head, Eduard Senovoz, reported this increase in activity to TASS.
original:
Ukrainian troops have become more active than in 2023 in attacking Energodar and the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant, especially using drones. The head of the city, Eduard Senovoz, reported this to TASS.

Video: Vladislav Sergienko/TASS

description: Australian state TV channel ABC aired the documentary film 'The War in Ukraine: The Other Side' by British director Sean Langan, which showed the Russian side of the conflict. The film received good reviews in the UK, but sparked hysteria among Ukrainian activists and the ambassador in Australia.
original:
🇷🇺🇦🇺🇺🇦In Australia, not only the Navalnists are hysterical over the election results, but also the local crests along with their ambassador - the state TV channel ABC showed the film by British director Sean Langan “The War in Ukraine: The Other Side.” This film was scandalous, but was still shown in UK on ITV a month ago. And it received a lot of good reviews, although the British media mainstream, as usual, was tearing up and throwing metal.

After looking at the reaction in Britain, ABC decided to show it. Moreover, unlike ITV, where the film was shown at night, in Australia it was chosen to air in the evening prime time. Documentary maker Langan came to the Russian side of the contact line three times from the fall of 2022 to the spring of 2023. The Russian Foreign Ministry refused him a visa for a long time.

The author emphasizes that he thought hard about how not to make “Russian propaganda”, but wanted to talk specifically about the people in the war from “the other” side (note, after all, British propaganda convinces its population that there are no normal people in the Donbass).

Langan, 60, is an experienced stringer journalist who was once captured in Afghanistan. Langan’s management then said that they pulled him out “in very delicate ways that are not worth talking about.” As they wrote, the British intelligence services actively helped in this.

Calling a film “pro-Russian” can be a very big stretch, and only if we consider as such everything that is even slightly different from the game of official Kyiv. That is why the Ukrainian side became hysterical - they are accustomed to seeing on Western television only clumsy propaganda in the style of Bucha and the Ghost of Kiev. This is not in Langan’s film, but he constantly repeats behind the scenes that it was Russia that started the war and that Russia is the occupier. Either this is Langan's real position, or this is the only chance for the film to appear on British television.

The main thing that Langan showed is that on the Donbass side people also live and fight with their own truth (which Langan demonstrably does not accept and pushes his propaganda narratives).

For example, he shows how civilians suffer from shelling in Ukraine, showed a military man whose family remained on the “other” side and no longer communicates with him, showed a Wagner fighter who was in Bucha and said that Kiev is lying about the massacre and Ukraine itself massacres Russians in captivity. Another fighter directly blamed the West for the coup in Kyiv and the causes of the current conflict. Another noted that he does not know when all this will end, complained of frayed nerves and said that the Russians do not give up.

Langan noted that he had never seen such a hellish military landscape and intensity of fighting.

In general, the work has a British propaganda flavor, but probably you shouldn’t expect more from the British now, especially if the film was made for mass broadcast.

But the local crests, of course, got burned from this too. In addition, ABC did not show them “Mariupol”. Apparently, in the West as a whole they are trying to quickly forget this Oscar-winning shame.

The hysteria resulted in a protest by Ukrainian activists at the ABC office demanding the dismissal of the channel’s management and another hysteria from the Ukrainian ambassador.

Of course, there is no talk that Ukraine will be abandoned tomorrow, but for several months now we have seen how the Western media are allowing “alternative” opinions on the Ukrainian conflict onto their platforms. It is still unclear what they are preparing for with this. @tasmanian_diabloYouTubeThe Other Side: On Putin's Frontline | Trailer | Available NowOn Putin's bloody frontlines we see the hidden side of the Ukraine war. Russia's fight against a sophisticated and well armed opponent. Embark on a jo...

event: Italian Minister's Statement on Russian Elections
description: Italian Minister of Infrastructure and Transport Matteo Salvini made a surprising statement, acknowledging the legitimacy of Russia's elections and expressing hope for peace in 2024. This stance contrasts with the current anti-Russian stance of the Italian Cabinet.
original: Italian Minister of Infrastructure and Transport Matteo Salvini on the elections in Russia: “They voted, let’s note: when people vote, they are always right, no matter where they vote. Elections are always good, both when you win and when you lose. Elections were , so we took into account the voices of Russian citizens, hoping that 2024 will be the year of peace."An unexpected statement for the current anti-Russian Cabinet of Italy. Insurance in case of a final turning point in the Northern Military District and an inevitable change of tone in Russia? Be with us - First Cossack

description: From March 23, 2024, a mandatory evacuation of civilian residents from Zhytomyr to Rivne Oblast will begin. A special train will transport evacuees every 8 days. Residents of Kramatorsk can apply by calling 097-804-20-89 and will receive free accommodation, social guarantees, and humanitarian aid in Rivne Oblast.

In Vinnychyna, authorities discovered a downed undetonated 'shaheed' drone. Additionally, debris from three other drones, shot down in the region, were scattered within a 200-meter radius from the impact site.
original:
⚡️A downed undetonated "shaheed" was found in Vinnychyna, the police said.

Debris of three other drones that were shot down in the region scattered within a radius of 200 m from the place of fall.

description: Ben Wallace, the UK's Defense Secretary, has given the green light for British troops to participate in the conflict in Ukraine. This move comes as the former Defense Minister advocates for increasing the country's defense spending to at least 3% of GDP.
original: Ben Wallace allowed the participation of British troops in the conflict in Ukraine. Against this background, the former head of the Ministry of Defense called for raising the minimum level of defense spending in the country to 3% of GDP. “We must use this phrase: we will not do this (bringing in troops. - Ed. ) exclude,” Daily Mail quotes Wallace. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Fighting broke out at the Ras Jadir checkpoint, a key trade route between Libya and Tunisia, between fighters of the Military Council of Zouara and employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The clashes occurred after the Military Council of Zouara attempted to remove Ministry of Internal Affairs personnel from the border crossing.
original: On Monday evening, fighting broke out at the Ras Jadir checkpoint, which is located on an important trade route between Libya and Tunisia (167 kilometers from Tripoli). According to eyewitnesses cited by the media, the fighting took place between fighters of the Military Council of the city of Zouara, which is formally part of the Ministry of Defense of the Government of National Unity sitting in Tripoli, and employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the same cabinet. The TV channel notes that the clashes occurred after fighters of the Military Council of Zuara tried to oust employees of one of the units of the Ministry of Internal Affairs who had arrived there from near Tripoli from the border crossing. The checkpoint is currently closed.

description: Two suspects were detained by transport police in the Baikal region for a murder committed in 1992. The suspects stabbed and pushed three passengers out of a moving train, resulting in two fatalities. Despite a 30-year delay, the investigation was reopened, and the suspects were traced and arrested.
original:
Forwarded from: Irina Volk
Another story about how punishment for a crime can overtake the perpetrator several decades later. My colleagues from the Baikal region transport police detained two accused of a murder that was committed in 1992. In the compartment of a passenger train traveling Novosibirsk - Chita, the attackers, during a conversation with fellow travelers, found out that they had money and expensive things with them. Choosing an opportune moment, the accomplices stabbed their interlocutors with knives and then pushed them out of the train while it was moving. Two passengers died from their injuries, the third victim was saved. The search for the criminals in hot pursuit did not yield any results. However, the work to solve crimes of past years made it possible to trace them despite the fact that more than 30 years have passed. Two suspects have been detained and the investigation has been resumed.#Subject toInvestigation@IrinaVolk_MVD

description: Ukrainian forces shelled the village of Pyatikhatki in the Central City district of Gorlovka, resulting in two civilian casualties.
original:
Forwarded from: Prikhodko RIK
⚡️As a result of shelling of the village of Pyatikhatki (Central City district of Gorlovka) from the Ukrainian Federal University, two civilian Gorlovka residents were wounded.@Prikhodko1970

description: Mosvodokanal employees from Moscow are conducting large-scale repairs of water supply systems in Donetsk. The plans for 2024 include restoring 20 water supply and sanitation facilities, as well as 34 heating network facilities, by replacing outdated steel pipes with plastic ones to improve water quality and increase supply volume.
original:
Forwarded from: NEWS DONETSK
Large-scale repairs of water supply systems are being carried out in Donetsk by representatives of the chief region - the city of Moscow. In plans for 2024, Mosvodokanal employees have plans to restore 20 water supply and sanitation facilities, as well as 34 heating network facilities. An outdated steel pipe, clogged with scale, sediment and slag, is being replaced with a plastic one will improve the quality and increase the volume of supplied water,” said Yuri Gusev, leading engineer of the construction control service of the Mosvodokanal Capital Construction Department. Vesti.Donetsk|Suggest news

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed the heads of the State Duma factions, emphasizing that the enemy's attempts to intimidate the Russian people will never succeed. He highlighted the resilience and determination of the Russian people, citing an example of a person who proudly declared their Russian identity despite being asked if they were scared.
original: The enemy will not be able to intimidate the Russian people, Vladimir Putin said at a meeting with the heads of the State Duma factions: Who has our enemy decided to intimidate? Russian people? Multinational people of Russia? This has never happened and never will happen. And you probably also noticed that even representatives of the foreign press approached people in difficult regions and said: “Where are you going? Aren’t you scared?” And such, already an adult, said: “I am Russian! And I will go where I need to go.” You see, what our enemy does, hoping to achieve a result, he achieves a result, but exactly the opposite of what was expected. That's all. They don’t understand who they are dealing with - with Russia, with the Russian people!📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Senior gunner 'Kleshch' of the MLRS 'Grad' unit in the Northern Military District zone discussed their combat operations. Their primary targets include armored vehicles, infantry, and UAV drone control points. They rapidly move to firing positions, aim, and engage targets, receiving confirmation of hits or misses. Corrections are made as needed, and new fire defeats are inflicted, bringing victory closer.
original: The senior gunner of the MLRS “Grad” with the call sign “Kleshch” spoke about combat work in the Northern Military District zone “Our main targets are armored vehicles and infantry, as well as control points for UAV drones. A target arrives, and we urgently move to a firing position. Within a few minutes we aim and carry out the defeat. When the target is completed, they give confirmation “hit or miss.” If corrections are needed, corrections are made, and only then we inflict a new fire defeat. At the same time, I feel proud and understand that all this power is falling on the enemy and bringing our victory closer,” says the senior gunner. @vsy200

event: Discovery of Enemy Drone Radio Beacon
description: Comrades from the field reported discovering a radio beacon on an enemy drone, designed to locate fallen drones. The autonomous device has a separate battery, GPS module, Lora Wan transmission module, BEC power supply, and power button. It can transmit powerful packages via LoraWan, potentially revealing troop locations.
original:
Forwarded from: Rosich | Rosich
Our comrades from the field report:

On the way out they dragged the enemy's Mavik, it had a box on it, it's good that he immediately cut off the Akum and took it for study, and the other guys picked up exactly the same one and brought it to their disposal and what do you think came to them, so warn the guys.

This is important information that can and should be shared. These or similar boxes are installed on enemy drones. They are distinguished by the presence of a Lora antenna and that’s it, they are not connected to anything. At the same time, they are tightly attached to the drone. Just a box with an antenna

Inside she has:
1. Separate own battery
2. Advanced GPS receiving module
3. Lora Wan transmission module
4. BEC power supply
5. Power button and buzzer

We at the Central Clinical Biological Bureau figured out what it was for, but quickly realized that it was a radio beacon for searching for fallen drones. Autonomous. Receives the jeep and sends rare but powerful packages via LoraWan. The protocol is energy-saving, can lie and transmit for a long time and far.

It would seem, well, a radio beacon, what could go wrong with it. Anything can go wrong with it: they captured the drone, turned it off, brought it to the support center. In a couple of hours it will fly at you in such a way that it won’t seem like much. Because with the help of this simple device you yourself will tell the Ukrainian where you sleep, eat and listen to lectures from your commanders.
 
There is a power off button on the box. So, I wouldn't trust her. I would also put a button on this device, and even solder everything correctly, but it would only turn off the buzzer. And no one would have guessed that nothing ever actually turns off.

Therefore, if you see an autonomous box with a Lora antenna, it is better to condemn it on the spot. Better yet, leave it in place and mine it. The crest will return for his habr, and there will be a gift. @rosich_ru

description: A meeting of countries supporting Ukraine's defense against Russian terror took place, with the Ukrainian Minister of Defense participating. The meeting resulted in new defense packs, including scarce artillery, and new states joining the Czech ammunition procurement initiative. Air defense, EW, and drones remain a priority, with Ukrainian drones already producing strong results.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the President
"Today is another "Ramstein", a meeting of countries that support our defense, our defense against Russian terror. This is a productive meeting, there are results. The Minister of Defense of Ukraine Umyerov participated. I am waiting for his detailed report. A few things can be said now. There will be new defense packs, including scarce artillery. New states join the Czech ammunition procurement initiative - thank you all. Of course, the priority regarding air defense, EW and drones remains unchanged. Thanks to all the countries that are really working so that this priority of ours is filled with appropriate content. Ukrainian drones are already producing strong results, and we need to significantly strengthen the international component of cooperation. The front should feel our increase on drones. I am grateful to all the participants of Rammstein and to the United States, Secretary Austin for his leadership."

Volodymyr Zelensky's address at the end of the 755th day of the war.

event: Meeting with World Youth Festival Participants
description: Kamchatka's head, Vladimir Solodov, met with regional delegation participants of the World Youth Festival. The young people presented their projects, including a procession idea, which Solodov supported and suggested holding on May 1, involving youth from various municipalities.
original:
The head of Kamchatka Vladimir Solodov met with participants of the World Youth Festival

Participants in the regional delegation presented their projects, in particular young people proposed organizing a procession. The head of the region supported this idea and proposed holding a procession on May 1 and attracting young people from various municipalities.

Let us remind you that the World Youth Festival was held in March 2024 on the federal territory of Sirius in accordance with the decree of Vladimir Putin.

The exercises were seen as a rehearsal for a possible invasion by North Korea, which declared South Korea its main enemy.
location: Pyongyang, Pyongyang Capital City, North Korea
original:
A video has gone viral on Western social networks where North Korean leader Kim Jong-un personally observes the launch of missiles. The North Korean leader personally supervised the launch of cruise missiles just a few days after the end of joint military exercises between the United States and South Korea, the video says.

North Korea said the exercises were a rehearsal for a possible invasion, declaring South Korea its main enemy. Flies beautifully!📮Subscribe to BREAKING

event: Rally and Concert for Crimea Reunification Anniversary
description: A rally and concert was held in Moscow to commemorate the 10th anniversary of Crimea's reunification with Russia. The event featured prominent figures, including Leonid Slutsky, Russian President Vladimir Putin, and other election participants, who gathered on Red Square.
original: A rally and concert was held in Moscow to mark the 10th anniversary of the reunification of Crimea with Russia. Leonid Slutsky spoke on Red Square together with Russian President Vladimir Putin and other participants in the election race.

description: The Russian military launched an airstrike, using aerial bombs with a universal planning and correction module, to destroy a temporary deployment point for Ukrainian saboteurs in the village of Ryzhevka, Sumy region.
original:
The Russian military destroyed a temporary deployment point for Ukrainian saboteurs in the village of Ryzhevka in the Sumy region.

According to the Ministry of Defense, the strike was carried out by aerial bombs with a universal planning and correction module.

description: A wounded roe deer, likely hit by a car, sought help at a clinic in Arsenyev. Veterinarians examined and treated the animal, with plans to release it back into its natural habitat.
original:
🦌A wounded roe deer came to the clinic in the seaside Arsenyev for help.

The animal was lying right on the porch of the medical facility. Presumably, she was hit by a car. The animal was examined by veterinarians and sent for treatment. Then they plan to return the roe deer to its natural habitat, the local administration reported.@radiomirby

event: Deployment of Data Center on Ice Floe
description: A team of specialists from RuVDS plans to install server equipment on a drifting ice floe in the Arctic. The data center is designed to operate in extreme conditions and withstand harsh climatic conditions. The equipment will be dropped from an IL-76 at over 10,000 meters and installed at the Barneo ice camp near the North Pole.
original:
The data center will be dropped onto an ice floe: a team of specialists from the Russian company RuVDS plans to install server equipment on a drifting ice floe in the Arctic. This unusual project involves dropping a server from an IL-76 from a height of more than 10 thousand meters. According to company representatives, the data center is designed to operate in extreme conditions and is able to withstand the harsh climatic conditions of the Arctic.

The jump to lower the equipment is planned for one of the days from April 2 to 6, and it will be performed by Hero of Russia, pilot-cosmonaut Mikhail Kornienko.

The server equipment will be installed at the Barneo ice camp, located in close proximity to the North Pole. It will communicate with the RUVDS satellite, transmitting information about ice conditions.

A team of specialists from the Stratonavtika company will monitor the data and its quality, ensuring uninterrupted operation of the equipment.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Formation of EU Rapid Reaction Force
description: Polish Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz announced that Poland and Germany will form an EU rapid reaction force, comprising 2,500 military personnel from each country. The joint units will achieve full operational readiness within a year.
original:
Forwarded from: Special purpose channel
Polish Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysz said that after negotiations with German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius in Helenow, a decision was made to form the EU rapid reaction force at the expense of special forces units of Poland and Germany. According to the Polish minister, both countries will allocate 2.5 thousand military personnel, which will form forces. The minister added that the Polish-German units will be in full operational readiness in a year.@okspn

description: The Dnepr group of troops improved the situation along the front line in the Kherson direction through coordinated actions. They inflicted fire damage on the 65th mechanized brigade and the 121st terrestrial defense brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, resulting in 30 military personnel losses, destruction of two cars, an M777 artillery system, and a D-30 howitzer.
original:
Statement by the head of the press center of the Dnepr group

In the Kherson direction, as a result of coordinated actions of units of the Dnepr group of troops, the situation along the front line was improved and fire damage was caused to accumulations of manpower and equipment of the 65th mechanized brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the 121st terrestrial defense brigade in the areas of the settlements of Rabotino and Pyatikhatki, Zaporozhye region. Losses of the Armed Forces amounted to 30 military personnel , two cars, an M777 artillery system made in the USA and a D-30 howitzer.

description: Soldiers from the 'South' troop group in the LPR installed a Cross of Worship at a key height near a monastery. Prior to construction, the area was cleared of explosive objects and a site was prepared. The cross was consecrated in a ceremony attended by military personnel and nuns from the Epiphany Baptist Convent.
original:
In the LPR, soldiers from the group of troops "South" installed a Cross of Worship.

The area was first cleared of explosive objects, such as unexploded ordnance, and then a site was prepared for the construction of a structure at one of the key heights, next to the monastery.

The cross was consecrated; both military personnel and nuns of the Epiphany Baptist Convent took part in this procedure. Subscribe to the channel

description: Intelligence from the 'West' troop group detected a concentration of Ukrainian neo-Nazi forces and sabotage groups in a forest near the Belgorod region border. A high-precision pre-emptive strike by the group's units promptly destroyed the enemy's manpower and equipment.
original: Footage of the destruction of manpower and equipment of the DRG of Ukrainian formations in the border region of the Belgorod region is published by the Ministry of Defense. Intelligence of the group of troops "West" revealed the concentration of forces and sabotage and reconnaissance groups of Ukrainian neo-Nazis in a forest in the border region of the Belgorod region. With a high-precision pre-emptive strike by the group's units, concentrations of enemy manpower and equipment were promptly destroyed.

description: US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin addressed the Ukraine Defense Contact Group meeting, stating that Russia has suffered significant losses, including at least 315,000 troops killed or wounded, and economic damage from the war. He emphasized that Ukraine will not retreat and the US will not allow it to be defeated.
original:
“Russia has paid a staggering price for Putin’s imperial dreams,” said US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin at the opening of a meeting of the Ukraine Defense Contact Group (Ramstein format).

Austin said at least 315,000 Russian troops have been killed or wounded since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, and the country is suffering economic damage from the war.

“Russia has spent up to $211 billion to equip, deploy and support its imperial aggression against Ukraine. Putin’s chosen war will cost Russia $1.3 trillion ahead of expected economic growth until 2026,” the US Secretary of Defense emphasized.

According to the United States, Ukraine has sunk, destroyed or damaged about 20 medium and large ships of the Russian fleet, and continues to shoot down Russian military aircraft. Austin noted that Ukraine will not retreat, and the United States of America will not allow it to be defeated.

description: Vasily Utkin, a renowned TV commentator and sports journalist, passed away at the age of 53. He was also the owner of the Egrisi media football club.
original: TV commentator and sports journalist Vasily Utkin died at the age of 53. This was reported by the press service of the Egrisi media football club, whose owner was Utkin.

event: Belgium Announces Armed Aid Package for Ukraine
description: Belgium has pledged a new package of armed aid to Ukraine, valued at 412 million euros. The package includes shells, nearly 300 Iveco Lynx armored vehicles, and 3 Alkmaar class minesweepers.
original:
Belgium announces a new package of armed aid for Ukraine worth 412 million euros.

It will include shells, almost 300 Iveco Lynx armored vehicles (fixed) and 3 Alkmaar class minesweepers.

description: French tennis player Arthur Cazeau lost consciousness on the Miami Open court. His opponent, Harold Maillot, initially thought he was experiencing cramps. The match referee and ball boy were slow to react, and it took some time for medical assistance to arrive.
original:
The tennis player lost consciousness on the Miami Open court - no one approached him for a long time.
An emergency occurred with the Frenchman Arthur Cazeau. The second athlete, Harold Maillot (also from France), later admitted: he thought his opponent was just having cramps.
Show more
The footage shows that the match referee did not react immediately. And the ball boy just came up and stood next to him until the doctor finally appeared on the court.
The tennis player was hospitalized, writes the Daily Mail. His condition is unknown

description: Operators of the joint group 'Inquisition' successfully undermined multiple military assets, including two trucks, one car, an anti-tank missile Sturm-s, two BMPs, and a 152-mm self-propelled gun 2C3 'Acacia'.

Two MiG-29s, acquired by private military company AirUSA (now Ravn Aerospace) in Kyrgyzstan, have been abandoned at Quincy Regional Airport in Illinois, USA, for almost ten years. The planes were purchased for the 'aggressor' program to simulate enemy air battles in training exercises.
original:
Forwarded from: AviaNews
Forgotten and abandoned in the USA MiG-29s At Quincy Regional Airport (UIN/KUIN), in Illinois, there are two MiG-29s acquired by the private military company AirUSA (now Ravn Aerospace) in Kyrgyzstan.

A pair of fighters were purchased for the “aggressor” program - services for simulating a possible enemy in training air battles. AirUSA/Ravn bought four MiG-29s in total, but the whereabouts of the second pair are unknown.

These two were unlucky, the planes have been “crushing concrete” for almost ten years now, the paint is gradually fading and it seems they no longer have any prospect of getting into the air. However, under the sultry Kyrgyz sun, nothing good awaited them either...# MiGDay@AviaNews

event: Slovenia Allocates Funds for Ukraine Ammunition
description: Slovenia has pledged a million euros to purchase ammunition for Ukraine as part of the Czech Republic's initiative. The Slovenian Ministry of Defense has confirmed the allocation, but details remain classified.
original:

However, the defense department does not provide details. They say this is classified information.

event: Proposal for Small Nuclear Power Plant
description: The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Romania has proposed building a small nuclear power plant near the border with the Republic of Moldova, specifically in Botosani County on the shore of Lake Costesti-Stinca. The location is ideal due to the presence of a hydroelectric power station and a 400 kV power transmission line that will supply the Republic of Moldova.
original:
The Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Romania asks the government in Bucharest to build a small nuclear power plant near the border with the Republic of Moldova, proposing to locate it in Botosani County on the shore of Lake Costesti-Stinca, along which the interstate border passes:

"Given that in Stanca-Costesti in Botosani County there is an important hydroelectric power station, the reservoir is one of the largest in the country, and the 400 kV power transmission line that will supply the Republic of Moldova will reach this point, we consider it appropriate to prepare a feasibility study for the construction station with a small modular nuclear reactor (SMR)".

The project for the construction of SMR reactors in Deutsesti in Romania is estimated at $4 billion and is designed for 6 years. Bucharest took out a loan against it from the US Export Bank.topiasi.roCentrală nucleară la 92 km de Iaşi?Camera de Comerț și Industrie Iași (CCII) a solicitat Guvernului construirea lângă lacul Stânca Costeşti (aflat la 92 km de oraşul Iaşi) a unei centra. ..

event: Telephone Conversation between Putin and Kadyrov
description: Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov congratulated Russian President Vladimir Putin on his election victory and pledged support for his future endeavors. Putin thanked Kadyrov and expressed gratitude to the Chechen people for their overwhelming support in the elections.
original:
Dear friends, today I had a telephone conversation with the elected President of Russia, during which I, on behalf of the entire Chechen people, congratulated Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin on his convincing victory in the elections. I wished him an inexhaustible supply of vitality and energy in public service and assured him of support for his great course for the benefit of the future of our Fatherland.

Our president thanked me for my support and asked me for a favor, which I perform with great pleasure.
Vladimir Vladimirovich conveyed his congratulations to Muslims on the occasion of the upcoming month of Ramadan, as well as words of sincere gratitude to the Chechen people. Our president noted that he sees the result that the Chechen Republic showed in the elections, is proud of it and is very grateful to everyone who supported him with their vote. I also join his words of gratitude. Indeed, the Chechen people have demonstrated great unity, self-awareness and interest in their future.

Once again, I congratulate Vladimir Vladimirovich and all Russians on the historic elections of the President of Russia!
Putin is OUR PRESIDENT!

description: The ongoing war in the Gaza Strip has resulted in over 30,000 deaths and the destruction of more than 70% of residential buildings, leaving 1.9 million people as refugees. The conflict shows no signs of ending, and a sustainable peace seems unlikely.
original:
Forwarded from: Kit
Is it possible to reconcile Israel and Palestine? Four scenarios of life after the war┬┴┬┴┤(・_・)├┬┴┬┴

“An endless circle of violence” is how US Secretary of State Antony Blinken succinctly described what is happening in relations between Israel and Palestine. The war in the Gaza Strip has been going on for five months. More than 30 thousand people were killed, more than 70% of residential buildings in the entire Gaza Strip were destroyed. Of Gaza's 2.3 million pre-war population, 1.9 became refugees. The worst thing is that there is no end in sight to the war, and sustainable peace seems almost impossible

However, there are several options for resolving the conflict. Some of them are more probable, others are completely fanatical. For example, the creation of a confederation modeled on the European Union, where Israel and Palestine will coexist peacefully like France and Germany, who fought 80 years ago.

In today's letter, orientalist Alexandra Appelberg will analyze all the available scenarios, as well as the reasons why it will be very difficult to implement them. Subscribe to the newsletter and you will immediately receive a letter with the text.

event: Russia Refuses Nuclear Dialogue with US
description: Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN, Dmitry Polyansky, stated that Russia does not see a basis for dialogue with the US on nuclear weapons. He believes that any new agreements would require the US and NATO to revise their anti-Russian stance and respect Russia's vital interests.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
❗️Russia does not see the basis for dialogue with the United States on nuclear weapons, said First Deputy Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the UN Dmitry Polyansky. He believes that concluding any new agreements in this area with the Americans is possible only after the United States and NATO revise their anti-Russian course.

“New agreements on nuclear and missile arms control cannot be isolated from the general military-political context. We do not see the basis for such work in the context of attempts by Western countries to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Russia and their refusal to respect our vital interests,” Polyansky explained during a speech at a meeting of the UN Security Council.

He also noted that the US actions indicate their disinterest in a serious conversation about nuclear arms control. And “hysterics and threats from Washington, London and Brussels” do not impress Russia. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300574VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

Eligible enterprises can receive up to 100 million rubles in loans on preferential terms, promoting environmental sustainability by reducing industrial waste in the Republic.
original: Manufacturers working in the LPR with secondary raw materials will be able to receive up to 100 million rubles in loans as state support through the regional Industrial Development Fund - Violetta Vorobyova, director of the regional Industrial Development Fund. "The LPR Industrial Development Fund has a "green" loan financing program "Recycling Projects", designed for manufacturers of products made from recycled materials. Under this program, enterprises of the Republic will be able to receive a loan of up to 100 million rubles on preferential terms. We will be able to support enterprises that help rid the territory of the Republic of industrial waste, which takes a long time to decompose and negatively affects the environment," she said.

description: Denis Baiguzhin, a self-proclaimed relationship specialist, was arrested on fraud charges. He allegedly used hypnosis and NLP methods in his trainings, which led to complaints from attendees about broken families and destinies. Baiguzhin has a history of fraud, having served 8 months in prison previously.
original:
Pimp and coach Denis Baiguzhin was arrested on charges of fraud.

The mega-relationship specialist willingly gave free advice to the weaker sex on how to build a relationship and marry the right man, preferably a millionaire. But most often, the visitors to his trainings complained, at best, about the lack of results, and at worst, about broken families and destinies. According to them, Baiguzhin used hypnosis and NLP methods in his classes.

At the beginning of his career, Denis Baiguzhin was a policeman, a private detective, and even served 8 months for fraud, and here he is again. This time - on a particularly large scale. An expert in the subtleties of seduction was put on the wanted list and arrested in absentia. Presumably, Baiguzhin is hiding in Turkey.

description: An interactive discussion, 'RUSSIA, MISHA, BALALAYKA', was held on Election Night 2024, showcasing public perceptions of Russia from different countries. The discussion confirmed stereotypes, including Italian associations with luxury, Serbian views of Russia as festive, American perceptions of Russia as strong and space-faring, and French views of Russia as culturally rich and powerful.
original:
During Election Night 2024, we held an interactive discussion “RUSSIA, MISHA, BALALAYKA”, where we showed the public images of Russia in the minds of residents of different countries, “generated”, by the way, by a neural network!
Do you know what's most interesting? When we discussed the generated images with real, living flesh and blood aliens, they
Show more
confirmed the stated stereotypes. So the hypotheses of our mini-research were confirmed!
What we found out:
The main associations with Mother Russia among Italians are balls, vodka and money. Roughly speaking, Russian chic as it is!
Our friends from Serbia imagine life in Russia as a mixture of dancing, wrestling and feasting. It seems that the Slavic brothers think of us as real Cossacks.
In the eyes of average Americans, the central association is the nesting doll, but space rockets, alcoholic beverages and a big strong man with a naked torso in the middle of winter cannot be avoided. In the best traditions!
Finally, sophisticated French people perceive Russia as a country rich in reading, intelligent youth, luxurious gastronomy and military power. No wonder Leo Tolstoy wrote his four volumes of War and Peace.
In general, some moments, of course, amuse, but this only emphasizes the versatility of our great vast Motherland and demonstrates the need to exchange cultural ideas with other peoples.
🪆
What stereotypes do you know about Russia?

event: Patient Given Urine Instead of Soup
description: A hospital patient in Florida was mistakenly given someone else's urine for lunch instead of soup. The patient's son discovered the mistake when he took a sip of the liquid, which smelled like urine. The nurse failed to provide a convincing explanation for the error, leading to a lawsuit.
original:
In Florida, a hospital patient was given someone else's urine for lunch instead of soup.

The son had just come to visit his sick father when a nurse appeared in the room with a tray. And on it stood a bowl supposedly containing broth. The son took a sip to see if it was hot. It turned out that there was no smell of broth there. And it smelled like urine, and not by chance, because it was urine. The nurse did not provide any convincing explanation as to how this could have happened. Hence the son's lawsuit.

description: Gazprom Neft's head, Alexander Dyukov, urged Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin to slow down the digital transformation of state-owned companies, citing the need for process continuity in the oil industry and unrealistic recommendations, such as abandoning Windows by 2025.
original:
Forwarded from: Gas&Money
Oil workers will not be able to abandon Windows until 2025. The head of Gazprom Neft, Alexander Dyukov, prepared a letter to Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin with a call to limit the frequency of digital transformation for state-owned companies. The Kommersant newspaper writes about this with reference to the letter.

Dyukov notes that since 2020, the Ministry of Digital Development has been making changes to the relevant documentation every year, which is why enterprises are forced to constantly update their strategies in this area.

At the same time, the continuity of processes is important for the oil industry to ensure the production of energy resources. This also applies to testing software for functionality. In addition, there are a number of unrealistic recommendations, in particular, the abandonment of Windows from 2025.

More details at the link: https://gasandmoney.ru/glavnoe/neftyaniki-ne-smogut-otkazatsya-ot-windows-do-2025-goda/Gas and Money Oil workers will not be able to give up Windows until 2025 The Kommersant newspaper writes about this

description: A criminal case has been opened against Tulun's Vice-Mayor, Elena Abramova, suspected of fraud. The investigation revealed that she organized illegal bonus accrual from 2019 to 2022, receiving part of the stolen funds and using them at her discretion.
original:
A criminal case has been opened against the vice-mayor of the city of Tulun, Elena Abramova, who is suspected of fraud. During the investigation, it was established that from 2019 to 2022, the suspect organized the illegal accrual of bonuses, after which she received part of these bonuses and disposed of the stolen funds at her own discretion. This was reported by the deputy head of the second department for the investigation of particularly important cases of the Investigative Directorate of the Investigative Committee of Russia for the Irkutsk Region, Viktor Lyukshinov.

At the moment, investigative actions are being carried out, the issue of choosing a preventive measure is being decided. Subscribe to REN TV

The work is planned to be completed by the end of the year. Subscribe | Suggest news

description: An English couple, Laura Lamonby-Parker and her partner, discovered a cache of almost 100-year-old letters behind their fireplace while renovating their home. The letters, dated from 1934 to 1937, were addressed to Miss Rhoda Taylor. The couple hopes to return the letters to the addressee's relatives if they can find more information about Rhoda Taylor's identity.
original:
"Manuscripts don't burn": An English couple in the midst of renovating their home discovered an amazing find behind the fireplace - a cache of letters that are almost 100 years old, reports Upi. "There were all these letters behind the fireplace. I don't know if the previous owners tried to burn them or they they just fell," said Laura Lamonby-Parker. According to the couple, the surviving letters date from 1934, 1935, 1936 and 1937 and were addressed to Miss Rhoda Taylor.

They contacted the previous owners of the house, but they did not have any information about the person with the name listed on the envelopes.

The Lamonby-Parkers said that they hope to return the letters to the addressee's relatives if they try to find more information about the identity of Rod Taylor. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Scholz's Statement on Russia and Ukraine
description: German Chancellor Scholz emphasized the need to send a clear signal to Russian President Putin, refuting his assumption that Western support for Ukraine will dwindle over time. Scholz highlighted the importance of sustained support for Ukraine, warning Putin not to expect a change in US policy.
original:
Scholz on the elections in Russia and the signal to Putin: The very first thing that is important now is to send a clear signal to the Russian president, who organized some kind of election. He must know that his assumptions that we will not be able to support Ukraine for as long as necessary are wrong. In other words, he should not expect that the United States will elect a president who will immediately bury Ukraine. He should not assume that we will not be able to mobilize sufficient support over time.
[At the beginning of the war, you had direct contacts with Putin from time to time, there were telephone calls. When was the last time you communicated directly with him?] The direct conversation was more than a year ago. The same goes for other people who had intense discussions with him, such as Emmanuel Macron. We both said we would do it again, but the time has to be right. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300649VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

event: Physician Cătălin Cărstoiu Announced as Joint Candidate for Mayor of Bucharest
description: Physician Cătălin Cărstoiu, head of the University Hospital of Bucharest, has been selected as the joint candidate for mayor of Bucharest by Romania's ruling coalition, comprising the Social Democrats and National Liberals.
original:
Physician Cătălin Cărstoiu, head of the University Hospital of Bucharest, has been identified by the parties of Romania's ruling coalition as the joint candidate of the Social Democrats and National Liberals for the post of mayor of the Romanian capital.

Ex-mayor Gabriela Fira from the SDPR and Energy Minister Sebastian Burduja from the NLPR, who at one time were candidates for candidacy, have been appointed as the leaders of the election campaign by Cârstoiu.

Tomorrow, Marcel Ciolacu and Nicolae Ciuca will officially present the candidate.

The 50-year-old doctor himself was a former member of the Democratic Party, twice elected as a deputy of the lower house, and is the son and attending physician of the ex-President of Romania Traian Basescu, whom he accompanied in 2006 to an operation in Vienna.

Synopsis: On the fronts of the Northern Military District, different people are fighting shoulder to shoulder - originally from from different cities and villages, different ages, with different life experiences. Together they carry out combat missions and are ready to help each other out in difficult times, which is never superfluous at the front.

Our hero, guard corporal, Evgeny Kim, shortly before the start of the Northern Military District, completed military service and entered into a contract with the Russian Armed Forces. In January 2022, being at home on vacation, he did not know what awaited him very soon in the service.

But no matter what happens, the senior operator of the Kornet installation is ready to take the fight, help his comrades in arms, and complete all tasks - and not for the sake of awards and orders. event: VI Conference of Young Scientists “Understanding the East”
description: The Oriental Faculty of GAUGN and the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences invite young scientists to participate in the VI conference of young scientists “Understanding the East” on April 25-26, 2024. The conference will cover various topics, including historical research, cultural studies, social and economic research, and political studies.
original:
⚡️📣Reception of applications for the VI conference of young scientists “Understanding the East” is open. The Oriental Faculty of GAUGN and the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences invite young scientists to take part in the work of the Sixth Annual All-Russian Scientific and Practical Conference of Young Scientists “Understanding the East” (April 25-26, 2024). The format is mixed. Participation is open to 2nd-4th year undergraduate and graduate students, as well as graduate students and young scientists under the age of 39.

The conference will be held in the format of four sections:
- Near Eastern Studies (Near and Middle East)
- Far Eastern studies (East, Southeast and South Asia)
- African studies (North Africa and Sub-Saharan Africa)
- Eurasian studies (Central Asia and the Caucasus) Main directions of the conference:
- Historical research
- Cultural studies
- Social and economic research
- Political studies: domestic and foreign policy, international relations
- Historiography and source studies For young scientists in the status of active teachers and researchers under the age of 39, it is planned to hold a round table “Historical politics and historical memory in the countries of Asia and Africa”. The deadline for submitting an application and abstract of the report is April 14, 2024. Details on the CAII website .#CAIS_events
