description: According to VTsIOM General Director Valery Fedorov, the level of citizens' trust in the Russian presidential elections has reached a 20-year high. A survey conducted on March 18 showed that 65% of respondents believe in the reliability of the voting results, while 18% acknowledged possible process violations that did not impact the outcome. Only 12% expressed doubts about the results.
original:
The level of citizens' trust in the Russian presidential elections is at the highest level in the last 20 years, said VTsIOM General Director Valery Fedorov.

He noted that the public opinion research center conducted its survey on the very first day after the end of the elections - March 18. And his results were surprising. “And now we have recorded not only a historical record for turnout and a historical record for the level of voting for the winner, but also a historical record for the last 20 years,” Fedorov clarified. According to the survey results, 65% of respondents said that they believe in the reliability of the voting results. 18% noted that there could have been some process violations on the ground, but they clearly did not have an impact on the result. And only 12% expressed doubts about the reliability of the results. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A sociology study in Germany revealed that 75% of respondents have little or no trust in the Bundeswehr, viewing it as a weak army with outdated weapons. Only 32% of Germans are willing to fight for their country, while 57% plan to avoid participating in a war. Reasons for this include the perception of the Bundeswehr's weakness, distrust of the current government, and a lack of patriotism and national pride.
original:
🇩🇪I would like to supplement the respected Daniel with details using the example of Germany, where quite representative sociology appeared on the relevant topic.

As we see, 75% have little or no trust in the Bundeswehr, or rather, they consider it a weak army with old and poor weapons, which is why in the event of war (no one is said, but the allusion to Russia is transparent) it will be crushed. Secondly, only 32% of Germans are ready to fight for Germany, and 57%, to one degree or another, plan to avoid participating in the war. This sociology is interesting because people name the reasons for their choice. And if the reasons that the Bundeswehr is considered weak are already obvious and objective, then everything is interesting about the Germans’ defense of their country.

So. Firstly, among the respondents there are irresponsible burghers who, apparently, are poorly exposed to Western propaganda and therefore do not believe in the possibility of a Russian attack on Germany, finishing off the right journalists with the question “why does Russia need this?” This is a separate category of people.
Secondly, many answer that the current government is harming Germany, and they do not want to defend it. A subtype of this category of citizens are those who do not want to fight, because the traffic light coalition has flooded the country with a liberal agenda, soldiers are bullied for their service because they do not fit into tolerance and LGBTIQLMN+, and in general, the agenda has ruined patriotism and national pride as concepts, considering them unacceptable. And the Germans don’t really want to fight for transgender people. The Greens are most blamed for implementing the agenda.

Thirdly, East Germans and AfD supporters tend not to fight: the latter are trying to ban the party, and they are humiliated and spread rot as supporters, and many East Germans simply do not fully consider Germany their state - in 1990, the West simply absorbed the GDR and I spent the 90s there so much that we will remember ours.

In other Western countries the picture will be almost the same, with the exception of the division into Ossi and Vessi, of course. Subscribe to the channel

event: Discovery of Enemy Drone Radio Beacon
description: Comrades from the field reported discovering a radio beacon on an enemy drone, designed to locate fallen drones. The autonomous device has a separate battery, GPS module, Lora Wan transmission module, BEC power supply, and power button. It can transmit powerful packages via LoraWan, potentially revealing troop locations.
original:
Forwarded from: Rosich | Rosich
Our comrades from the field report:

On the way out they dragged the enemy's Mavik, it had a box on it, it's good that he immediately cut off the Akum and took it for study, and the other guys picked up exactly the same one and brought it to their disposal and what do you think came to them, so warn the guys.

This is important information that can and should be shared. These or similar boxes are installed on enemy drones. They are distinguished by the presence of a Lora antenna and that’s it, they are not connected to anything. At the same time, they are tightly attached to the drone. Just a box with an antenna

Inside she has:
1. Separate own battery
2. Advanced GPS receiving module
3. Lora Wan transmission module
4. BEC power supply
5. Power button and buzzer

We at the Central Clinical Biological Bureau figured out what it was for, but quickly realized that it was a radio beacon for searching for fallen drones. Autonomous. Receives the jeep and sends rare but powerful packages via LoraWan. The protocol is energy-saving, can lie and transmit for a long time and far.

It would seem, well, a radio beacon, what could go wrong with it. Anything can go wrong with it: they captured the drone, turned it off, brought it to the support center. In a couple of hours it will fly at you in such a way that it won’t seem like much. Because with the help of this simple device you yourself will tell the Ukrainian where you sleep, eat and listen to lectures from your commanders.
 
There is a power off button on the box. So, I wouldn't trust her. I would also put a button on this device, and even solder everything correctly, but it would only turn off the buzzer. And no one would have guessed that nothing ever actually turns off.

Therefore, if you see an autonomous box with a Lora antenna, it is better to condemn it on the spot. Better yet, leave it in place and mine it. The crest will return for his habr, and there will be a gift. @rosich_ru

event: Establishment of Hero of the Russian Federation Title
description: Today marks 32 years since the establishment of the title Hero of the Russian Federation, the highest degree of distinction awarded for exploits and valiant deeds in the name of Russia. Over 1,000 heroes, including military personnel, doctors, firefighters, and law enforcement officers, have received this award for showing courage and heroism in difficult situations.
original:
Birthday of the “Golden Star”Today marks 32 years since the establishment of the title Hero of the Russian Federation. This is the highest degree of distinction, which is awarded for exploits and valiant deeds in the name of Russia. The status of Hero of Russia is a symbol of heroism, dedication and patriotism.

Exactly 32 years ago, on March 20, 1992, the title of Hero of the Russian Federation was introduced, for which a person is awarded the distinctive Gold Star medal. This award remains an undeniable symbol of heroism to this day. Over the entire period of its existence, the title of Hero of the Russian Federation was awarded to more than 1,000 heroes, including military personnel, doctors, firefighters, law enforcement officers and other citizens who showed courage and heroism in difficult and dangerous situations.

Heroes of Russia have become symbols of courage and self-sacrifice; their names live in the hearts of people and in the history of the country. They have become an example for many generations and inspire heroism and good deeds. Such a date is obliged to call on all citizens of the Russian Federation to pay tribute to the Heroes who accomplished a feat for the sake of the Motherland and remind us of the importance of heroism, patriotism and self-sacrifice. Let's celebrate this day, honor the memory of heroes and strive for achievements in our lives.#factology@anna_news

description: The Choiseul Institute conducted a study, 'Africa 2050', surveying 300 entrepreneurs from 34 African countries. The study found that 62% of respondents preferred foreign investment, with Europe being the most preferred source. The majority of respondents (53%) favored European investors, with Germany and France being the top choices.
original:
Forwarded from: Zangaro Today
​​The magazine “Wives Africa” drew attention to a study by the French independent analytical center Institut Choiseul (Choiseul Institute) called “Africa 2050”, which was based on surveys of 300 entrepreneurs from 34 African countries (20 of them from French-speaking and 14 from English-speaking). We are talking about managers of private and public companies, as well as persons responsible for making decisions on economic issues.

The most interesting part is where respondents answer the question about the trade and investment partners most in demand for them in the coming decades. Despite the growing investment activity of Morocco and Nigeria, when asked about the origin of investments, the majority (62%) preferred foreign, or more precisely, extracontinental FDI. The most preferred source of foreign investment turned out to be Europe, whose countries remain leaders in terms of the volume of accumulated investments (primarily the UK with €55.6 billion, as well as France and the Netherlands). In general, more than half of respondents (53%) spoke in favor of European investors.

Respondents from French-speaking countries (59%) are especially willing to cooperate with the EU. At the same time, among the EU countries, the leaders of sympathy were Germany (69%) and France (61%). Next - but by a large margin - comes Spain (18%). It is interesting that if in French-speaking countries sympathy for Germany (64%) and France (61%) was divided approximately equally, then 83% of interlocutors from English-speaking countries who spoke in favor of Europe preferred German investors.

In general, 16% of respondents preferred Chinese investors, 11% preferred North American investors, and only 3% preferred Russian investors. At the same time, Anglophone countries are somewhat more focused on trade and investment relations with China (24%), the United States (17%) and Russia (4%) and somewhat less focused on the EU (37%).

Respondents assessed their countries' overall economic prospects up to 2050 mostly positively (81%). 97% were in favor of creating a common continental market, while 83% assessed its prospects as realistic. Respondents see the greatest prospects in the agricultural industry (63%) and energy (60%). Next - by a wide margin - are digital technologies (36%) and industry (32%). It is curious that the prospects for the mining industry are rated worst of all – 24%.

The answers to the question about the reasons that, from the point of view of those surveyed, hold back the development of their countries did not come as a surprise. 74% put political problems in first place. Next come security concerns (50%), lack of investment (48%) and climate change (34%). 82% assessed the state of infrastructure negatively, while 56% of businessmen are optimistic about its prospects, and 43% are cautiously optimistic. 67% are concerned about problems with hiring qualified personnel, and approximately the same number (66%) are not satisfied with the state of professional training in their country. Sustainable development issues were named a priority by 70% (in particular, researchers emphasize that climate change could reduce agricultural productivity by 20% by 2050).

description: EU High Representative Josep Borrell discussed the transfer of income from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine, highlighting the need for a legal basis and careful consideration of financial consequences. The proposal requires thorough study of the legal framework to ensure consistency with international law.
original: Borrell - on the transfer of income from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine: The question itself lies in the legal basis and financial consequences of the seizure not of assets, but of income received from these assets. I can’t say that anyone was against it, but everyone wanted to have a specific proposal in order to carefully study the legal framework. I understand it. We live according to the laws of the rule of law; we cannot take measures arbitrarily. The decisions we make must be supported by international law or be consistent with international law. Some Member States want to carefully study the text that will be presented to them in a couple of days.

event: Belgium Approves Additional Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Belgium has approved an additional 412 million euros in military assistance to Ukraine, including the transfer of three Tripartite minesweepers, up to 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles, armored ambulances, and reconnaissance UAVs. The largest part of the aid package is the supply of artillery ammunition worth 373.1 million euros, sourced from the Ministry of Defense's own stockpiles and international group purchases.
original: Belgian Defense Minister Ludivine Dedonder reported that the Belgian government has approved the allocation of an additional 412 million euros for military assistance to Ukraine. It is planned to transfer three Tripartite minesweepers to Ukraine (photo) in partnership with the Netherlands. Belgium will organize basic training for Ukrainian personnel at the Naval Academy, and the Netherlands will provide on-the-job training for crews. The Belgian Ministry of Defense will also provide maintenance for these ships. It is also planned to transfer up to 300 Iveco LMV Lynx light armored vehicles to Ukraine and jointly with other Benelux countries purchase armored ambulances and reconnaissance UAVs for Ukraine. The largest part of the latest aid package is the supply of artillery ammunition worth 373.1 million euros. The ammunition will be supplied from the Ministry of Defense's own stockpiles, as well as through international group purchases from various companies. The largest part of the aid package is the supply of artillery ammunition to Ukraine worth 373.1 million euros. The ammunition will be supplied from the Belgian Ministry of Defense's own stockpiles, as well as through international group procurement from various companies.

event: Cossack Child's First Haircut and Horse Mounting
description: In an ancient Cossack custom, a one-year-old boy's hair was cut for the first time by his godmother, surrounded by female relatives. The boy was then handed to Cossacks, who carried him to a temple where a horse was waiting. The boy's reaction to being placed on the horse was believed to predict his future fate as a warrior.
original:
The first haircut of a child and his mounting on a horse are from the most ancient customs of the Cossacks. When the boy was one year old, the godmother, surrounded by female relatives (but without his own mother, who is not present at the child’s baptism), sat him on a felt mat and cut his hair for the first time in his life.

After this, the women handed the shorn Cossack boy to the Cossacks, who carried him to the temple, where a bareback horse was waiting for the boy. Having covered the horse with a scarf, they sat the Cossack girl on top of it, trying to predict how his future life would turn out, what the fate of the future warrior would be.

If a baby started crying and fell off his horse, then it was believed that his fate was unenviable: over time he would be killed. And if the Cossack kid grabbed the mane and held on tightly to the horse, it was believed that he would remain alive in any trouble. #portrait_of the Cossacks Be with us - The First Cossack

event: Rat Grounds Sri Lankan Airlines Airbus A330-300

original:
Forwarded from: MAKS Airshow
A rat grounded a Sri Lankan Airlines Airbus A330-300 for 3 days. The rodent was spotted on board during a flight from Pakistan to Sri Lanka on February 22, as a result of which the aircraft had to be grounded for at least 3 days while the search for the little traveler was underway.

The long delay was due to the fact that the aircraft had to be thoroughly inspected to ensure that the rat had not damaged any critical systems and that further travel on the aircraft would not pose a risk.

After that, the vessel, registered 4R-ALO, made its first flight only on February 27, according to Flightradar24.

It is worth noting that this incident could have deeper consequences for the state-owned airline, which is already subject to severe criticism due to its inability to consistently operate flights.

The procedure for its privatization has already been launched, however, due to constant reputational failures, more and more investors are turning away from SriLankan Airlines, questioning its sale.📸Lars Steffens#PostfactumMAXimum Aviation: Telegram&MAX-2024Souvenirs&Clothing for those in love with the sky

The rest of the Ukrainians are in a stable condition, there is no threat to their lives.

description: Elon Musk questioned the continued existence of NATO, citing the dissolution of the Warsaw Pact Organization, the alliance's original archenemy. He agreed with David Sachs' assessment that NATO expanded to create hostility and justify its own existence.
original:
Elon Musk said he doesn't understand why NATO continues to exist

David Sachs, whose post Musk commented on, wrote in X that after the collapse of the USSR, the alliance faced an “existential crisis” because the reason for its existence no longer existed. However, instead of disbanding, NATO came up with a new mission - to expand in order to "create the hostility necessary to justify itself," says Sachs. "Exactly. I've always wondered why NATO continues to exist, given that its archenemy and the reason for its creation , the Warsaw Pact Organization has ceased to operate,” Musk responded to the publication.

description: Russia is conducting an active cognitive operation against Ukrainian President Zelensky, aiming to undermine his democratic legitimacy as his five-year term comes to an end. The campaign seeks to discredit Zelensky and Ukraine in the West, promoting his 'illegitimate' agenda in the United States, and ultimately, to confuse the West and present Ukraine as an unreliable partner.
original:
Russia is waging a campaign to undermine Zelensky's power. According to Bloomberg, Moscow is conducting an active cognitive operation against Ukrainian President Zelensky. The information campaign is connected with the end of his official powers in May of this year.

“Central to the Kremlin’s efforts is an attempt to undermine Zelensky’s democratic legitimacy in the eyes of the public as his five-year term comes to an end without a vote for re-election.”

Most recently, we provided insight into how the Russian IPSO “The Ninth Wave” discredits Zelensky and Ukraine in the West. The peak of such an operation may actually be at the end of May - June.

Moreover, according to our information, the Russians are also promoting Zelensky’s “illegitimate” agenda in the United States. This argument clearly plays into the hands of the Republicans (and Trump’s closest supporters, in particular).

The Kremlin has long relied on the return of Trump and the erosion of NATO from within. Therefore, Moscow’s tactical goal is to confuse the West and present Ukraine as an unreliable partner for the implementation of strategic goals: chaotization of the EU and the establishment of its own rules throughout the geopolitical space of Europe. Bloomberg.com Ukraine Braced for Russian Disinformation Attacks on Zelenskiy Ukrainian authorities are worried that President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is vulnerable to a Russian disinformation campaign that will seek to undermine his authority.

description: A Ukrainian M1 Abrams tank, introduced to the battlefield, was destroyed by Russian forces in the Avdeevsky direction. The tank, part of the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade 'Magura', was initially damaged by ATGMs and RPGs, and then finished off with an FPV. The enemy's attempt to intimidate Russian troops with the tank ultimately failed.
original:
The emergence of the M1 Abrams. Defeat on the battlefield.
A view from our side. HISTORY. From the moment this tank was introduced into the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we could observe “terrible PR.” There are a lot of photos on social networks of him driving somewhere, shooting somewhere. Yes, indeed, the Abrams is one of the three heaviest tanks, with the Merkava Mk.4M in first place.

After this tank began to be delivered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, everyone wondered in which direction it might jump out. At that time, the hottest place was Zaporozhye, where the enemy lost large quantities of foreign equipment (M2 Bradley, Leopard 2, Challenger 2).
 
Six months have passed. Videos began to appear again, this time showing the direct operation of the tank against the positions of the Russian Armed Forces from a closed firing position. A week later, it was discovered by ZALA scouts in the Avdeevsky direction, where it was soon destroyed, first put on the gusl by a crew of ATGMs and RPGs, and then finished off with FPV. GOAL. The enemy from the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade "Magura" decided to use this equipment is used to intimidate the troops of the Russian Armed Forces. But this is war, and there is no invulnerable equipment here, as our guys proved with the example of the famous tank.
 
We assume that the enemy has an old version of the tank without “uranium armor.” Otherwise we would have had to tinker with him longer. This machine is heavy and slow due to its size. He performed well in the sand, but today there are different conditions, different rules of engagement. Here they will destroy you with a drone for 50,000 rubles, without looking at what the equipment is made of and where it was brought from, and even more so in such dimensions as the Abrams it will be difficult for our FPV operators to miss. HOW DID the M1 Abrams APPEAR ON THE BATTLE FIELD? Stocks of armored vehicles in the warehouses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are depleted every day. Post-Soviet modernized T-72s have been practically destroyed, and deeply modernized T-64s are not able to compete with modern weapons during battles. RESULT: Having relied on American technology, the enemy again miscalculated; modern warfare dictates new rules.
If this continues, they will soon end. @rusich_army

description: Russian blogger-humorist Evgeniy Trikoz, known for ridiculing Putinism and criticizing Kremlin propaganda, is receiving death threats. The threats began after a publication by Z-blogger Vasily Vinokurov, which led to the release of personal information about Evgeniy and his family. The attackers demand an apology video to war participants in Ukraine and Putin, threatening death if not complied with.
original:
Forwarded from: ASTRA
A Russian blogger-humorist who ridicules Putinism and criticizes the Kremlin’s propaganda is receiving death threats. Evgeniy Trikoz spoke about this on his Telegram channel. He said that the attack began with a publication by Z-blogger and investor Vasily Vinokurov, in which he called for complaints about the comedian Mizulina. Then Z-publics began publishing personal information about Evgeniy and his family, and then the comedian began receiving messages with death threats. The attackers demand that Evgeniy record a video apologizing to the participants in the war in Ukraine and Putin, since they were allegedly insulted in the blogger’s humorous videos. Otherwise, the comedian is threatened with death. “They punched the address. They intimidate and threaten to kill! Maximum publicity! Do you want to come? Forward! If something happens to me, you know who will be guilty of it!” wrote Evgeniy. Evgeniy Trikoz is also known for his comic “surveys” on the streets (video 2 and video 3), in which he ridicules the theses of the Kremlin propaganda.

event: Concerns Over American Military Presence in Denmark
description: Danish activists have raised concerns about the increasing American military presence in Denmark, citing agreements with Finland, Sweden, and Denmark for the deployment of US troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. The activists argue that this presence could lead to Denmark being drawn into geopolitical conflicts and potentially compromise its defense and security policies.
original:
Forwarded from: Severyanochka
🇩🇰🇺🇸Here Danish activists became concerned about the American military presence in Denmark.

We are talking about a series of US defense agreements with Finland, Sweden and Denmark on the deployment of American troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. Of course, with an eye to the military development of the Arctic and counteraction to Russia. Since December last year, various pacifist movements have been holding conferences and seminars on the topic of involving quiet and calm Scandinavia in geopolitical showdowns.

And lately, the theses that are voiced there have become more and more acute. Especially considering that the American presence will only expand.

Here I have pulled out the most interesting, in my opinion, arguments that the Danes use when trying to ask their government about the possible risks of such an aggressive policy. Although this is reminiscent of a voice crying in the wilderness: Up to 36,000 American soldiers are stationed in Germany. At the same time, the German Government, especially in the last two years, has been destroying its economic potential, including depriving itself of access to cheap energy resources due to the abandonment of Nord Stream from Russia. The question is, does the presence of American troops in Germany help the German government make decisions that lead to such results? - writes Line Lauridsen from the organization Tid til Fred. An agreement with the United States would mean a serious violation of two basic principles of Danish defense and security policy: the absence of foreign troops on Danish ground and the absence of nuclear weapons on Danish soil...The US has a policy of never publishing or answering questions about whether it stores nuclear weapons on its military bases. We encountered this, for example, in Greenland, where the United States did not report that it had nuclear weapons at the Thule base, says Tove Jensen, an activist from the Peace Initiative organization. /dkdox.tv/videos/DK24002[26:06]

description: In March 2014, over 5,000 Ukrainian military personnel came under Crimean authorities' jurisdiction. Russian military took control of key military units, including Belbek, and blockaded Ukrainian ships in Streletskaya Bay and Lake Donuzlav. The 'polite people' special operations forces played a crucial role in the annexation, leading to Crimea's autonomous status and eventual joining of the Russian Federation.
original:
10 years since Crimea is ours!
10 years of Russian Spring!

During the period of March 2-3, 2014, more than five thousand military personnel of the internal troops, the State Border Guard Service and the Armed Forces of Ukraine came under the jurisdiction of the Crimean authorities.

The military unit in Belbek is almost completely controlled by the Russian military. Ukrainian soldiers and officers surrendered their guns and warehouses, but took up defensive positions in the administrative building.

The ships of the Russian Black Sea Fleet "locked" the Ukrainian ships "Ternopol" and "Slavutich" in Streletskaya Bay. A Russian military boat blocked the exit from Lake Donuzlav, where 13 Ukrainian ships are located.

A decision is made to refer to the autonomous status of Crimea and for the republic to join the Russian Federation

A special role in the return of Crimea was played by “polite people” - special operations forces, which consist of military intelligence officers, paratroopers, and special forces of other branches of the military.

The dog gave his life saving our soldiers from an FPV drone.
A dog came to the soldiers on the front line; they called him “Dooby”; he was a loyal and fearless friend.
Noticing that the soldiers were running away from kamikaze drones, he definitely
Show more
regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Ukrainian fpv flew into the position, people began to run away and hide, and he, “The Goon,” rushed to defend his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth... Happy memory and honor to “The Goonie”! 🫡

description: A rescue operation is underway in Odesa following a Russian 'Shaheed' attack. 215 people, including rescue workers, police, and utility workers, are involved. Ten people, including three children, have been confirmed dead, and five have been saved. The search continues for those still trapped under the rubble.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Odesa. The rescue operation at the place where the Russian "Shaheed" was hit continues. Rescue workers, policemen, utility workers are working, a total of 215 people are involved. Thank you to every volunteer who helps.

At this time, ten people are known to have died, including three children: Mark, who was not even three years old, Elizaveta, eight months old, and Timofey, four months old. Ukrainian children are military targets of Russia. This is who these non-humans are fighting. My condolences to all relatives and friends.

All victims are provided with the necessary assistance. Five people were saved. It is known that children may still be under the rubble. The search will continue until the fate of everyone who was in the house is ascertained.

Thank you to everyone who participates in the rescue operation, who supports people, helps the wounded. And I thank everyone who destroys the occupiers, Russian equipment and logistics.

Every Russian loss at the front is our state's response to Russian terror. The world must react to every manifestation of Russian evil and retaliate against Russia's actions. Every Russian terrorist act ignored by the world allows for more killing.

We must win this war. Only Ukrainian power will be able to ensure a normal life for Ukrainians.

description: Tigran Karapetyan, a resident of Khimki near Moscow, was detained for defrauding at least four insurance companies, including Ingosstrakh, Rosgosstrakh, Renaissance Insurance, and Alfa-Insurance, of almost RUB 10 million. He orchestrated fake accidents, providing fake photos and documents to receive insurance payments.
original:
One of the auto framers who scammed Ingosstrakh with fake accidents was detained. In total, the man defrauded at least four insurance companies of almost RUB 10 million.

As SHOT learned, operatives detained Tigran Karapetyan, a resident of Khimki near Moscow. According to investigators, he defrauded not only Ingosstrakh, but also other insurance companies. Karapetyan offered to stage accidents to various people in order to get money for them. The scheme was always the same: a fake accident, fake photos and documents, a trip to the insurance company, receiving the required payments. In total, more than 20 similar episodes were identified in which Ingosstrakh, Rosgosstrakh, Renaissance Insurance and Alfa-Insurance were affected. The total damage to insurance companies amounted to more than RUB 9 million.

Now the investigation is identifying Karapetyan’s accomplices, who helped him carry out his shady schemes. The auto fixer and his friends face up to ten years in prison under the article “Insurance Fraud.” Subscribe to SHOT

description: Officer Kolovrat, a senior department member, died on February 3 during heavy fire on his position. Despite having the opportunity to leave, he chose to stay and protect his comrades. A massive explosion occurred, and Kolovrat was found dead at the epicenter. He was a volunteer from Nizhny Novgorod who served in the Northern Military District.
original:
Voenkor Sreda tells how Kolovrat died:
An officer died, a video of which was shown on federal television channels after the successful assault on Avdiivka. Interviews with him were published immediately after the capture of Promka. He was one of the senior members of the department.
Show more
The tragedy occurred on February 3. The position where Kolovrat was located came under very heavy fire.
As eyewitnesses said, Kolovrat had to leave the position, but could not do this, since the lives of his comrades depended on his actions. He could have gone out, but did not do so.
At some point there was a monstrous explosion. Kolovrat found himself at the very epicenter of the explosion. Later, several dead were found at the arrival point, among whom was Kolovrat.
And I still can’t believe that he died.
Kolovrat was a volunteer. I came to the Northern Military District from Nizhny Novgorod.

description: The number of Ukrainian deserters has doubled, with a sharp increase on the front line and a fivefold increase in refuseniks. Ukrainian officers are fined for desertion of subordinates, and many combat units lack at least 40 percent of personnel due to hidden desertion.
original:
🇺🇦The number of Ukrainian deserters has doubled. Ukrainian channels report this with reference to the OP. According to them, in addition to the sharp increase in deserters on the front line, the number of refuseniks has increased almost fivefold.

Ukrainian officers are fined for desertion of subordinates. Therefore, if a soldier says that he would rather go to prison than face bullets, he is kept in the rear. Only according to data from 2023, many combat units of the Ukrainian Armed Forces lack at least 40 percent of personnel. And almost everywhere there is hidden desertion. Military personnel feign illness and try to stay at headquarters and rear units rather than go to the front line.

description: Scientists from Belgorod State National Research University published the first Lingala-Russian phrasebook, marking a significant step in Russia's African initiative.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
Peculiarities of the Russian approach: “Many people do not understand us, but we are able to understand everyone...” Great initiative from below. This is what should be our specialty in our return to Africa. European swagger must be replaced by our Russian approach. After all, if you look at it, we are unique. Vyatka State Technical University at the opening of the World Youth Festival in Sirius!
Yesterday the long-awaited grand opening of the World Youth Festival 2024 took place!
20,000 young leaders gathered on one site.
Show more

description: A Ukrainian UAV was inspected, revealing a makeshift assembly of assorted Chinese boards, Raspberry Pi Pico breakout boards, and other components. The UAV's intelligence is based on multiple Raspberry Pi boards, each programmed separately under Linux. The system lacks embedding and uses a camera to read telemetry. Autonomous orientation is performed using orangecube and pix, but only heading data is used.
original:
Forwarded from: UAV Developer
2/2In on-board electronics - trash and waste. A surprising combination of assorted Chinese boards from alishkas, boxes, from plastic serial ones to home-made aluminum ones with rivets and sealant, with neat assembly on spacers and with tips (!!) on plates specially cut for blocks. Even for the goat video capture card EasyCap, which costs 300 rubles (by the way, it is responsible for digitizing AI telemetry), a special plate was made with holes for zip ties.
The basis of the boat's intelligence is a lot of raspberry pi pico breakout boards, shoved in all directions. The creators of this miracle clearly did not know how to use embedding, so they programmed each relay activation separately under Linux. There, literally every function is included on a separate RPi board! Even inside the same box! The boards have an isolated CAN on the ADM3053, but none are connected to the jet ski ECU, and the telemetry is read by a camera.
Autonomous orientation is performed on orangecube and pix. Most likely, only heading data is used to make it easier for the pilot to steer by hand. In marine conditions, the cube will not provide any long-term orientation.
Streams of data from the Starlink Zoo flow into Mikrotik rb962. Most likely, control on Starlink is organized through tunnels, which is why the microt is located there.
The pile of RPi wasn’t enough for them, so they also added some kind of PC to the center. Alas, they didn’t let me unscrew the cooler, so you can write in the comments what kind of computer it is.
Thermal imaging camera from Flir, visible spectrum - another webcam, similar to looking at the tidy of a jet ski.

The cost of such a magura is 250 kilobucks, just for a moment.

Actually, always remember that no matter how much pomp the Ukrainians present their product, inside there will be snot, drool, grandma’s closet and Mikrotik on tape.

Here the critic will exclaim: but it works! Why don't we?
Sometimes it works, efficiency is ~1:10. And we also have a fleet. What do crests have to drown with them?
And geraniums also work well for ports.

But if suddenly people from the fleet are reading me, show the admiral the anti-torpedo nets and grooves. Well, to be honest, it’s not funny anymore...

description: Residents of the Kirovsky district in Volgograd are being sued by local utility workers for ₽1 billion over six months due to the lack of legalization of sewerage pipes by the contractor. Despite paying ₽14,000 over four years, residents are being held responsible for the contractor's failure to legitimize the system.
location: Kirovsky District, Volgograd, Volgograd Oblast, Russia
original:
> ₽1 billion for six months. This is exactly how much residents of the Kirovsky district in Volgograd will have to pay for sewerage - they were sued by local utility workers, who are not satisfied with the fact that the pipes of Volgograd residents were not legalized by the contractor. In Volgograd there is an area almost entirely built up by the private sector. Until 2015 there was no sewage system. A little later, a small company that laid pipes approached the residents with an offer to help. True, despite the agreement, the contractor did not begin to legitimize the sewerage system, and as a result, according to the papers, communications turned out to be non-existent, locals told Readovka and confirmed in the Water Supply Concession.

For several years, people from the private sector have contacted Water Supply Concessions LLC, which supplies water throughout Volgograd. Residents wanted to legalize their sewerage so that water would flow into their homes. But at some point, everything did not go according to plan. The owners were sued for approximately ₽1.5 million each, including very young children, for 289 days of 2022. In total, the entire district receives more than ₽1 billion. Among the defendants are even first-graders and kindergarteners, although in total over the past four years, residents have paid ₽14 thousand in the region.

In turn, “Concessions” are refused to conclude contracts due to the lack of a technical inspection certificate for the network, which they themselves do not issue, local resident Lyubov told Readovka. According to the latest data from the company, each household discharges 400 cubic meters of water under full pressure, which differs from the meter readings. By the way, the contractor, because of whom they are trying to oblige residents to pay fabulous amounts, is not a co-defendant, and Concession told Readovka that they calculated the amounts based on “methodological recommendations.”

event: Russian President's Address to Federal Assembly
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed the Federal Assembly, discussing the development of a 'new' society based on patriotism. He emphasized the importance of patriotism as the main component of any ideology, particularly among civil servants and the elite.
original:
Forwarded from: BelVPO
Maybe ideology in the state is not so bad? Indeed, yesterday’s speech about the “new elites” and the national projects announced by Russian President Vladimir Putin during his address to the Federal Assembly are a serious signal for the entire Russian society.

In essence, the President gave impetus to the development of a “new” society based on patriotism.

It should be noted that patriotism is the main component of any ideology! And the basis of this ideology is the education of patriotism, not only among the people, but above all among civil servants, that is, in other words, among the elite.

In turn, ideology is an indicator of state civilization, which is its foundation and core basis.

Unfortunately, there is no ideology at the legislative level in Russia; moreover, it is prohibited. Thus, paragraph 2 of Article 13 of the Constitution of the Russian Federation states: “No ideology can be established as state or mandatory.”

For comparison, in the Constitution of the Republic of Belarus, in particular, Article 4 defines: “Democracy in the Republic of Belarus is carried out on the basis of the ideology of the Belarusian state, as well as the diversity of political institutions and opinions.” Quote: “The core of the ideology of the Belarusian state is social justice and patriotism,” - President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko

By the way, Belarusians, like Russians, come from the Soviet Union, but our ideology remains in our country. If we turn to history, then Russia has always had certainty in its views and its own national idea.

Thus, for the Russian Empire of the 19th century, the official state ideology was “Orthodoxy - autocracy - nationality.” In Soviet times, state ideology was based on the philosophy of Marxism-Leninism - building a fair and equal society. It is worth remembering the famous communist slogan “From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs.” Thus, throughout its history, except for the last 30 years, the existence of Russian statehood has been associated with ideology. Until 1991, Russia experienced revolutions, emerged victorious in a world war, made an industrial breakthrough, and all this was permeated with ideology. And over the past 30-odd years, liberals who have absorbed Western “values” have only multiplied. Navalny’s “hamsters” and Upper Lars boys appeared who abandoned the country in difficult times. To sum up, one can only ask a rhetorical question: “Maybe ideology in the state is not so bad?”

Perhaps Russia will soon find answers to this question, and will not attribute everything to Western democracy, freedom and pluralism. CHANNEL/CHAT/ZEN/KONT/ok.ru/vk/instagram/YOUTUBEBelvpoMaybe ideology in the state is not so bad ? •Yesterday’s speech about the “new elites” and the national projects announced by Russian President Vladimir Putin during his address to the Federal Assembly are serious...

It is not yet clear whether a new US aid package will be provided. If this does not happen, then in order to fully compensate for American support in 2024, Europe will have to double supplies and speed up the transfer of weapons to Kyiv, experts say.

description: Drone Industry Insight (DroneII) released a report detailing the state of investment in the global drone industry. In 2023, investments collapsed, with a total funding of $1.7 billion, down from $3.3 billion in 2022 and $3.5 billion in 2021. The decline is attributed to decreased investment in new companies, geopolitical events, supply chain issues, inflation, and investor caution.
original:
Forwarded from: Drone
Drones descend.

Leading German analytics company Drone Industry Insight (DroneII) has prepared another report detailing the state of investment in the global drone industry. And judging by these analytics, in 2023 these investments not only decreased, but collapsed.

The total volume of funding for companies producing drones in 2023 amounted to $1.7 billion. And this seems to be a lot by any standards, but in 2022 this volume was $3.3 billion, and in 2021 - $3.5 billion. That is, a sharp drop is visible to the naked eye. This happened due to a decrease in investment in promising new companies.

The value of transactions after the IPO doubled, but the number of transactions themselves decreased. That is, significantly fewer companies began to receive funding, but if they do receive it, it’s decent money.

● 71% of global investment comes from North American companies, including large investments in Zipline and Skydio. In 2021, North America's share was 75%;

● Europe comes next with 17%. In 2022 it occupied 12%, in 2021 - 7%;

● then the Middle East and Africa region - 6%;

● and Asia - 5%. In 2021 it accounted for 14%, in 2022 - 8% of investments.

At the same time, a significant part of the funds was directed to companies producing components for drones and robotics. And funding for drone maintenance companies has exceeded investment in software development companies.

Investments are declining, but there is no single reason for this. Geopolitical events, supply chain problems, inflation and investor caution are all to blame. Laws have also not kept pace with drone developments around the world, forcing some companies to close. And this already undermines investor confidence in the industry as a whole.

Explosive growth in 2021-2022 was driven by the pandemic and people’s belief that delivery should now be carried out by drones and robots. But if we remove this factor, then investments have been growing steadily since 2017 and will continue to grow in 2024 and beyond, despite the failure.

event: Signing of Framework Agreement for LOTR Kleszcz Supply
description: The Armament Agency of Poland's Ministry of National Defense signed a framework agreement with AMZ-Kutno SA to supply 286 advanced wheeled combat reconnaissance vehicles, LOTR Kleszcz, to the Polish Army between 2025-2035.
original:
On February 28, 2024, the Armament Agency of the Ministry of National Defense of Poland signed a framework agreement with the Polish company AMZ-Kutno SA for the supply of 286 advanced wheeled combat reconnaissance vehicles LOTR Kleszcz ("Tick") to the Polish Army in the period 2025-2035. The first executive contract under this agreement is due to be signed this year.

LOTR (Lekki Opancerzony Transporter Rozpoznawczy) Kleszcz was developed according to the program of the same name based on an agreement concluded back in December 2013 between the National Center for Research and Development (NCBR) and a consortium of Polish enterprises led by the AMZ-Kutno plant, which also includes the Military Institute communications, Military Institute of Weapons Technology and Military Institute of Chemistry and Radiometry. The reconnaissance version of the vehicle was developed on the basis of the Bobr-3 (4x4) armored personnel carrier created earlier by AMZ-Kutno; the first Kleszcz prototype was presented for testing in 2020. In the Polish army, these vehicles should replace the old BRDM-2.

Kleszcz (4x4) has a total combat weight of up to 14 tons, has a length of 7 m, a width of 2.5 m and a height of 2.4 m. The vehicle is equipped with a 7.2-liter diesel engine producing 326 hp. and is capable of highway speeds of up to 100 km/h with a range of up to 600 km. The wheel suspension is independent. The vehicle is amphibious, the speed afloat is up to 7 km/h. Declared ballistic protection of the hull level STANAG 4659 Level 2 (with the possibility of increasing to Level 3) and mine protection Level 2b. https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4806651.htmlLivejournalPolish "Tick" On February 28, 2024, the Armament Agency of the Ministry of National Defense of Poland signed framework agreement with the Polish company AMZ-Kutno...

description: Elon Musk expressed his confusion about NATO's continued existence, citing the dissolution of the Warsaw Pact Organization, its original archenemy. He commented on a post by David Sachs, who mentioned NATO's expansion after the Soviet Union's collapse.

“I have always wondered why NATO continues to exist, despite the fact that its archenemy and the reason for its creation, the Warsaw Pact Organization, has ceased to exist,” he wrote in X.

This was his comment on a post by entrepreneur David Sachs, who said that after the collapse of the Soviet Union, NATO “faced an existential crisis and, rather than disband, came up with a new mission: to expand.”

Let us note that from time to time there are predictions in the media that if Trump is elected President of the United States, he will withdraw America from the Alliance.

description: A Ukrainian M1 Abrams tank was destroyed by an FPV crew in the Avdeevsky direction. The tank, part of the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade 'Magura', was used to intimidate Russian troops but was ultimately taken out due to its size and slow speed.
original:
The emergence of the M1 Abrams. Defeat on the battlefield.
A view from our side. HISTORY. From the moment this tank was introduced into the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we could observe “terrible PR.” There are a lot of photos on social networks of him driving somewhere, shooting somewhere. Yes, indeed, the Abrams is one of the three heaviest tanks, with the Merkava Mk.4M in first place.

After this tank began to be delivered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, everyone wondered in which direction it might jump out. At that time, the hottest place was Zaporozhye, where the enemy lost large quantities of foreign equipment (M2 Bradley, Leopard 2, Challenger 2).
 
Six months have passed. Videos began to appear again showing the direct operation of the tank against the positions of the Russian Armed Forces from a closed firing position: standard tactics, shot - quick escape. A week later, it was discovered by ZALA scouts in the Avdeevsky direction, where it was soon destroyed by an FPV crew. GOAL. The enemy from the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade "Magura" decided to use this equipment to intimidate the troops of the Russian Armed Forces. But this is war, and here There is no invulnerable technology, as our guys proved using the example of the famous tank.
 
We assume that the enemy has an old version of the tank without Uranium Armor. Otherwise we would have had to tinker with him longer. This machine is heavy and slow due to its size. He performed well in the sand, but today there are different conditions, different soil and different rules of engagement. Here they will destroy you with a drone for 50,000 rubles, without looking at what the equipment is made of and where it was brought from, and even more so in such dimensions as the Abrams it will be difficult for our FPV operators to miss. HOW DID the M1 Abrams APPEAR ON THE BATTLE FIELD? Stocks of armored vehicles in the warehouses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are depleted every day. Post-Soviet modernized T-72s have been practically destroyed, and deeply modernized T-64s are not able to compete with modern weapons during battles. RESULT: Having relied on American technology, the enemy again miscalculated; modern warfare dictates new rules.
If this continues, they will soon end.

"Archangel of Special Forces"

description: The AsterX 2024 exercise, held at the French National Center for Space Research in Toulouse, will focus on countering threats in space. NATO countries, Japan, and South Korea will participate, practicing scenarios such as anti-satellite weapons, cyber attacks, satellite rendezvous, and jamming, covering the entire spectrum of space wars.
original:
Forwarded from: Chronicles of the Space Age
On March 14-15, 2024, the AsterX 2024 exercise will be held at the French National Center for Space Research in Toulouse, which will be dedicated to countering threats in space. NATO countries will take part in them, as well as representatives of the armed forces of Japan and South Korea.
According to the command of the French Aerospace Forces, the exercise scenario was formed around threats that exist now or may arise in outer space in the future. Thus, the list of exercises that participants will perform includes anti-satellite weapons, including directed energy, cyber attacks, maneuvers to rendezvous with alien satellites and jamming. It is indicated that the scenario “covers the entire spectrum of space wars.”

Natalya Krachkovskaya died 8 years ago. Natalya Krachkovskaya dreamed of leading roles all her life, but became the queen of the episode. The unforgettable comedic actress played in dozens of cult films.

Over more than 50 years of film career, Krachkovskaya has starred in more than 90 films. The most famous films with her participation: “Ivan Vasilyevich is changing his profession”, “This cheerful planet”, “It can’t be!”, “Strawberry”, “The Marriage of Balzaminov”, “Operation “Trust””, “Cipollino”, “Kalina Krasnaya” , “Tsarevich Prosha”, “Near the Black Sea”, “Two Captains”, “The Investigation is Conducting”, “The meeting place cannot be changed”, “Take care of the men!”, “Pokrovsky Gate”, “Premonition of Love”, “There on unknown paths...", "Evenings on a farm near Dikanka", "And life, and tears, and love", "The Legend of Love", "After the Rain on Thursday", "Beauty Salon", "An additional one arrives on the second path", “The Man from Capuchin Boulevard”, “The Noble Robber Vladimir Dubrovsky”, “One, two - no trouble!”, “The Maid of Rouen nicknamed Pyshka”, “Private Detective, or Operation Cooperation”, “The weather is good on Deribasovskaya, or It’s Raining on Brighton Beach Again,” “Alphonse,” “The Master and Margarita,” “Monday’s Children,” “Beware: Children!”

In the last years of her life, Krachkovskaya did not act in films and practically did not appear on stage. Her legs were giving out, and the directors were afraid that problems might arise with Natalya Leonidovna on the set.

The actress died of a heart attack at the age of 78 on the morning of March 3, 2016 in a hospital. On March 5 she was buried at the Troekurovsky cemetery. In August 2021, her husband Vladimir Krachkovsky was reburied next to her. On the actress’s grave there is still only a peeling cross.#calendarPhotos and video selection of fragments from popular Soviet comedies with the participation of Natalya Krachkovskaya.TelegraphPhotos

event: Ukrainian BMPM2A2 ODS-SA Bradley Survives Hits
description: A Ukrainian BMPM2A2 ODS-SA Bradley tank withstood two hits in the Avdiivka direction. The BRAT dynamic protection unit absorbed one of the blows, while the second hit damaged the tower blocks.
original:
Ukrainian BMPM2A2 ODS-SA “Bradley”, which withstood two hits in the Avdiivka direction.

One of the blows fell on the BRAT dynamic protection unit, which took the entire blow. The second one caught the blocks on the tower. Military Informant

event: First Flight of PZL I-22 Iryda
description: On March 3, 1985, the PZL I-22 Iryda combat training aircraft made its first flight. The aircraft was designed to replace the PZL TS-11 Iskra and featured a high-wing design with retractable landing gear, two PZL K-15 engines, and a maximum speed of 940 km/h.
original:
Forwarded from: Main airfield🇺🇦
📅This day in aviation history

March 3, 1985 - first flight of the PZL I-22 Iryda combat training aircraft (aka M93 Iryda and M96 Iryda).

In 1976, the Warsaw Aviation Institute began work on a new jet trainer aircraft. It was planned to replace the PZL TS-11 Iskra. The project was designated I-22 Iryda, and production was to be carried out by the aircraft manufacturer PZL-Mielec.

The I-22 was a two-seat high-wing aircraft with retractable landing gear. Equipped (in the M93K version) with 2 × PZL K-15 engines with a thrust of 14.7 kN. Maximum speed is 940 km/h, flight range is 1200 km. Armament - 23 mm cannon + up to 1100 kg of bombs/missiles on 4 hardpoints.

Although the I-22 Iryda had good flight characteristics, it did not go into full mass production. Due to problems with engines and budget cuts for testing in the Polish Air Force, the aircraft was delivered only in 1992-94. But an accident in 1996, difficult relations between the Air Force and the manufacturer, and a decrease in funding led to the closure of the project. In 1998, all orders for the M96 Iryda were cancelled. By this time, only 17 aircraft had been built. #ThisDay

event: Azerbaijani Air Force Showcases Bayraktar Akıncı UAV
description: The Azerbaijani Air Force demonstrated the Bayraktar Akıncı, a Turkish-made high-altitude multi-purpose long-range reconnaissance and strike unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV). The 'heavy' drone has a 20-meter wingspan, 12.2-meter length, and 4.1-meter height, with a maximum take-off weight of 6000 kg and payload capacity of 1500 kg.
original:
News from a subscriber:
The Azerbaijani Air Force showed the Bayraktar Akıncı UAV
Bayraktar Akıncı (from Tur. - “Flag Raider”, “Bayraktar Akıncı”), Turkish high-altitude multi-purpose long-range reconnaissance and strike
Show more
aircraft-type unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV).
The attack and reconnaissance UAV "Bayraktar Akıncı" belongs to the class of "heavy" drones.
The wingspan of Bayraktar Akinci is 20 meters, the length of the device is 12.2 meters, the height is 4.1 meters. The maximum take-off weight declared by the manufacturer is 6000 kg. In this case, the maximum payload weight is 1500 kg. The declared operational flight altitude is 30 thousand feet (approximately 9150 meters), the service ceiling of the device is 40,000 feet (approximately 12,200 meters), and stays in the air for 24 hours. The drone can fly in fully automatic mode, land and take off independently. Maximum speed - 360 km/h, cruising speed - 240 km/h.
Military Informant

description: The Kherson region's humanitarian headquarters received approximately 650 tons of cargo since the beginning of 2024. The cargo was transferred from various regions of the country, with the Donskoy, Noginsk, and Nevsky rescue centers of the Ministry of Emergency Situations providing the most assistance.
original: Since the beginning of 2024, the humanitarian headquarters of the Kherson region has received about 650 tons of cargo. Different regions of our country transfer cargo to the humanitarian headquarters of the Kherson region. The Donskoy, Noginsk and Nevsky rescue centers of the Ministry of Emergency Situations most often help. “Residents of the Kherson region can receive humanitarian assistance upon a pre-submitted application. You must contact the administration at your place of residence,” said the regional Ministry of Labor and Social Protection.

event: Exhibition 'NATO: A History of Deception' Opens
description: An exhibition titled 'NATO: A History of Deception' was opened at the WFM, showcasing physical evidence of NATO's hypocrisy in waging a proxy war against Russia through the Kiev regime. The exhibition features NATO weapons used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, road signs damaged by Western cluster munitions, and other objects, leaving foreign guests shocked and questioning NATO's true intentions.
original:
“NATO: A History of Deception” is an exhibition that reveals to foreign guests the true nature of the “collective West.” To demonstrate the hypocrisy of Western elites waging a proxy war against Russia at the hands of the Kiev regime, the exhibition “NATO: A History of Deception” was opened at the WFM. The exhibition consists of physical evidence. Here you can see NATO weapons used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, road signs riddled with Western cluster munitions, and other objects.

As foreign guests note, the exhibition is shocking and makes you think about what exactly NATO is trying to achieve by fueling the conflict. “The exhibition very well shows the bad policies of NATO and America, they want war,” emphasized a guest from Iran, Reja Ahadi Shahri.

description: During the evacuation of a damaged infantry fighting vehicle in the Avdeevsky direction, specifically in the village of Vodyanoye, a collision with an anti-tank mine occurred. Fortunately, everyone involved is alive and well. The incident was captured on film by Russian military correspondent Vittorio Rangeloni, a former Italian citizen.
original:
Forwarded from: Unofficial Bezsonov
#exclusiveFull video. Yesterday, in the Avdeevsky direction in the village of Vodyanoye, during the evacuation of a damaged infantry fighting vehicle, there was a collision with an anti-tank mine. The evacuation process was filmed by former Italian citizen and now Russian military correspondent Vittorio Rangeloni. Everyone is alive and well. Today we’ll talk about this and more with Vittorio on the air “The Other Side of TsIPsO”. @NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

event: Development of Luft Pinoy Air Minivan
description: An American startup, LuftCar, and the local company eFrancisco Motor Corporation (eFMC) are developing a unique electric air car, the Luft Pinoy air minivan, designed to connect the 7,000 Philippine islands. The prototype is expected to begin flying this year, offering a convenient transport solution for island residents.
original: The Luft Pinoy air minivan will connect seven thousand Philippine islands. A prototype of a strange electric chimera air car should begin flying over the Philippines this year: its front part is a regular minivan, and its rear part is an airplane. So far this is just a concept, but it is expected that such a device will become a convenient transport for residents of the island state. The development is being carried out by the American startup LuftCar and the local company eFrancisco Motor Corporation (eFMC).

description: A devastating attack in Odessa resulted in the death of the entire Kravets family, including parents Oleg and Tatyana, and their three children: 8-year-old Zlata, brother Sergei, and 7-month-old Lisa. The family's bodies were found under the rubble of their destroyed house.
original:
The body of 8-year-old Zlata, the daughter of deceased soldiers Oleg and Tatyana Kravets, was found under the rubble of a house in Odessa. Governor Oleg Kiper announced this.

Earlier, the bodies of her brother Sergei and sister Lisa were found. Thus, the whole family died - two adults and three children.

In total, 12 people died in Odessa.
